Title: Journeyman-Gas - May accept apprentice
Job Description:
Primary Job Duties and Responsibilities (Essential Job Function)

Under general supervision, performs duties of Utility Operator; performs all types of work (except welding) in connection with construction, operation, and maintenance of gas facilities and may install, but not connect, other underground utilities.
Typical Duties
Performs work in safe manner. Complies with all applicable safety rules, regulations and procedures. Performs all work that they are qualified and trained to do in a manner to protect themselves, fellow employees and the public from injury.
Locates underground gas and electric facilities in conjunction with their work. Additionally, performs locates where no Locator/Leak Surveyors exist.
Performs mechanical type tasks such as the fusing of and installation of plastic pipe, installation of steel pipe, installing sleeves, unions, clamps, ells, tees, and crosses. May bury other underground utilities. Applies protective coating on steel pipe and fittings. Installs locating wire on plastic and steel facilities, installs cathodic protection devices and takes reads. Assist with setting, removing and piping large meters and regulators. May perform miscellaneous restoration work.
Responsible for work being performed in accordance with Company and department rules, regulations, policies, procedures, and construction standards. Reads and interprets drawings and specifications and works from prints, sketches and/or verbal instructions.
Operates main drilling, tapping and stopping equipment.
Completes leak survey and investigation of gas facilities with combustible gas indicators (CGI and FI), flame ionization equipment, bar-hole testing, and soap.
May assist with measurements and field paperwork required in connection with operations, maintenance and construction work, including the requisition of materials.
Installs gas meters through class 2, regulators and vents on residential, commercial, and industrial services in association with maintenance and construction work. Assists others in regards to industrial and commercial sets, regulators and vents.
Re-lights and inspects gas equipment when performing maintenance on services, replacing services, and moving location of services.
Maintains work area in a neat, orderly and safe condition.
Leads, trains and instructs employees in their work.

Typical Duties

N/A
Qualifications
CDL required
Pipeline and highway alcohol and drug testing
Employees must be able to perform the essential functions of the position, with or without an accommodation. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

Title: Staff Surveyor
Job Description:
Imagine a place where responsibility is shared equally among all employees. Where leaders are approachable, and the open-door policy is the rule. Where employees are tasked to be innovative and work with an entrepreneurial spirit.

Welcome to Manhard Consulting! We see problems as an opportunity for creativity, and we are looking for problem solvers to join our dynamic team. Our firm is organized into small teams to give you a strong sense of accountability and to achieve great results.

Job Summary:
This position must be able to work independently on houseline plats, plat of survey, subdivision plats, plats of easement, plats of dedication, topographic surveys, ALTA surveys, boundary surveys, and block sheets for field crews for construction staking services.

Accountability and Duties:
Ensures timesheets are submitted accurately and on time.
Provides an accurate accounting of time spent on projects with descriptions for each time entry on a daily basis.
Keeps supervisors informed of work load and any changes in project scope or additional services.
Maintains a good relationship with clients and staff.
Works closely with other disciplines on multi-discipline projects.
Responsible for timely completion of drafting projects.
Mentors and trains Survey Technicians.
Organizes and maintains survey job files.
Accurately completes all houseline plats independently.
Accurately completes plat of survey independently.
Accurately completes boundary surveys independently.
Accurately completes ALTA surveys independently.
Accurately completes topographic surveys independently.
Accurately completes subdivision plats independently.
Accurately completes plat of easement independently.
Accurately completes plats of dedication independently.
Accurately prepares legal descriptions independently.
Accurately completes block sheets for field crews for construction staking services independently.
Participates in marketing, sales, and business development efforts where or when requested by supervisor.
May supervise or coordinate the work of Survey Technicians and/or field surveyors.
Qualification Requirements:
0-4 years of CAD (AutoCAD Civil 3D preferred)
0-4 years of Field Survey experience
Education and/or Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Surveying or 24 semester hours of college surveying

Certificates, Licenses, Registrations:
Valid driver’s license

Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Excellent oral and technical written communication skills.
Strong sense of urgency and self-initiative to meet client deadlines
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Available to work overtime as needed to complete projects
Available to occasionally work in the field performing surveying tasks
Knowledge of industry related software
Proficient with AutoCAD Civil 3D
Desire to learn and improve CAD skills and survey knowledge
Ability to make independent decisions within a general framework
Must be fluent in the English language
Physical Demands:
Must be able to read reports and use the computer. Must hear well enough to communicate with coworkers. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to stand/walk, climb/stoop/kneel, lift/pull/push, grasp/feel. Must be able to write, type, and use phone system. Must regularly lift and/or move up to 25 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds, and occasionally lift and/or move up to 100 pounds.

Employer’s Disclaimer:
Position subject to possible modification to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities.

Manhard does not accept unsolicited resumes from any 3rd party agencies. No fee will be paid to 3rd parties who submit unsolicited resumes to any Manhard employee. Resumes from approved vendors must be specifically requested by Manhard and approved by the Manhard Talent Acquisition Team.

Manhard Consulting is proud to offer equal employment opportunities to all applicants for employment and prohibit discrimination and a harassment of any type based on race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. We support inclusion and believe in welcoming a collective sum of individual differences, thoughts, traits, and characteristics to represent our culture and achievements.

Title: Survey Project Manager (2+ Years PM Experience)
Job Description:
Survey Project Manager (2+ Years PM Experience; Local Candidates Only; Hybrid)
MWM DesignGroup is looking for a self-directed and proven Surveying Project Manager experienced with public and private sector projects. .
You’ll have the opportunity to manage survey projects, engage with designers on public infrastructure and land development projects, working with our team of civil engineers, architects, and landscape architects. If you are looking for growth opportunities in your career while working in a great team environment, then come join us at MWM DesignGroup!
We offer variety in our work. Recent and ongoing design projects include higher education, K-12, recreational, civic, transit, horizontal mixed-use and commercial.

If you enjoy working in a team environment and collaborating with other professionals including architects, engineers, and permitting expeditors to design high-impact projects that define our community - then come join us at MWM DesignGroup!

Title: Utility Inspector/ Surveyor
Job Description:
Forge ahead with WSB. WSB was founded on the understanding that culture drives results and we’ve dedicated ourselves to the value of strong relationships, collaboration, and forward-thinking ideas. We’ve inspired each other to discover thoughtful and creative solutions that look beyond the needs of today to the opportunities of tomorrow. We invite you to forge ahead with us.
Our Pipeline group is growing, and we have immediate openings for full-time, entry-level, and experienced Natural Gas Pipeline Construction Inspectors and Surveyors. We offer exceptional opportunities in our Survey and Construction Inspection areas. If you want more than a job and if you’re looking for a career with growth opportunities and a chance to be a leader, WSB is the place for you.
What You Will Do: We have roles for entry-level and experienced natural gas pipeline inspectors and surveyors who want to better themselves and want to be challenged. You will be part of our Construction Services Pipeline Group working around natural gas distribution pipelines and facilities. As a Utility Inspector/Surveyor, you will be enforcing strict adherence to client requirements as it relates to the safety and construction of natural gas pipelines.
Responsibilities and expectations will include:
The ability to pass the Operator Qualification modules and other training requirements in a timely fashion.
All aspects of the job are to be performed with an emphasis on safety.
To build and maintain a working knowledge of federal, local and company compliances.
Field observation including verifying and documenting federal, local and company compliance. This will include:
Completing inspection reports daily. All documentation is completed electronically on a company provided iPad including: Daily Reports, Pictures, Schedules, Time, and Expenses.
Working with detailed plans and procedures, tracking quantities and material and verifying the accuracy of mapping and as-built documentation
Inspection of installation of natural gas pipeline activities including: Excavation, installation, and backfill/restoration.
Proficiency with:
Trimble GPS
Trimble total station
Construction Staking
Record keeping
Plan reading
Mapping
Typical work hours range from 40 to 60 hours per week, 5-6 days per week. There are no limits to your growth and how you can progress with your career at WSB.
What You Will Bring:
Required:
Excellent technical, communication, and organizational skills
You must have the ability to work in a variety of weather conditions and navigate terrains associated with construction sites.
Ability to ascend or descend into areas at job side to complete inspections.
Additional requirements include a minimum of a high school diploma.
Valid driver’s license with a good driving record is required.
A pre-employment drug test as well as quarterly random drug testing is also required.
Ability to lift up to 75 lbs.
You must be comfortable working in all weather conditions. Due to the physical nature of the work, you must be able to lift 50 lbs. – 75 lbs. periodically. You’re required to work with your hands, and stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. At times you may be working at or on uneven terrain, slopes, in confined spaces, or reinforced trenches.
Preferred:
Current CWI/CPWI (this is a certificate our client requires for certain tasks)
Candidates with knowledge of CP, QA/QC or CFR49/192/195 or who are Certified Welding Inspectors (AWS CWI)/CPWI, NACE Cathodic Protection Level 1 thru 4, or NACE Coating Inspector Level 1 thru 3.
A two-year technical degree from an accredited school in a field related to civil engineering construction is a plus, and/or a degree from a four-year accredited college will increase your opportunities for growth.
Familiarity with construction processes, installation methods, utility mapping (as-builts)
Survey experience
Who We Are: WSB is a design and consulting firm specializing in engineering, community planning, environmental, and construction services. We provide solutions for the places, spaces and systems that support our lives. We offer services in more than 30 complementary areas across the nation.
WSB does not accept resumes from third parties.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, or other legally protected status.

Job Description:

Surveyor 3 - PN20051989
(230002Y7)
Job Duties
Surveyor 3, PN 20051989
Who We Are:
The Ohio Department of Transportation (ODOT) oversees building and maintaining the nation’s 5th largest interstate system and the 2nd largest number of bridges. We take pride in providing safe and efficient roadways for the people of Ohio and to the people traveling within our great state. And in order to achieve that, we do A LOT! From Planning, Engineering, Construction to Law, HR, Communications, IT and everything in between, ODOT has a career for just about everyone. ODOTers are hardworking, passionate, and dedicated to public service. We strive to achieve our agency’s vision every day: To be a long term, reliable, professional, and highly productive organization.
We Support Diversity, Equity and Inclusion: ODOT values its diversity, and is committed to cultivating an inclusive and equitable work environment for all employees - one where differences are respected and celebrated. Our agency continues to build a workforce that champions the advancement of DEI principles and initiatives.
Ohio is a Disability Inclusion State and strives to be a Model Employer of Individuals with disabilities. The State of Ohio is committed to providing access and inclusion and reasonable accommodation in its services, activities, programs, and employment opportunities in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and other applicable laws. If you have a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to utilize the Careers.Ohio.Gov Website Portal, send an email to odi@das.ohio.gov.
ODOT's Mission Statement:
To provide easy movement of people and goods from place to place. We will:
Take care of what we have
Make our system work better
Improve safety
Enhance capacity
What You Will Do:
Join the ODOT - District Three Capital Program - Real Estate Division

Be part of a multi-discipline team.
Work daily with project managers, design engineers, right-of-way design personnel, surveyors, utility coordinator and others.
Utilize your experience to assist with right of way plan review and compliance in order to facilitate property acquisition for new right-of-way and easements to serve project needs while reducing impacts to private property.
Must have a thorough understanding of, and ability to read and prepare construction & right of way plans and understand how they interact.
Research records in courthouse & other locations (e.g., grantor & grantee indexes, tax maps & plats).
Review boundary surveys and analyzes survey result.
Be involved from scoping projects to delivering final product to acquisition team - Cradle to grave.
Analyze, develop and implement policies and procedures for Right-of-Way and Utility Relocation.
Coordinate long and short-term operational plans, budget, staff & equipment needs with supervisor.
Meet with Project Managers & Acquisition Team to review right-of-way problems and recommend solutions.
Meet with public, property owners & public officials regarding takes (acquisition), existing & proposed right-of-way plans or/and acquisition of property.
Will report directly to Real Estate Administrator.

Benefits to you:
Extensive benefits including medical, vision, dental and basic life insurance
11 paid holidays per year
Paid time off with vacation, sick and personal leave accruals
At least a 14% employer contribution in to your OPERS pension plan
Pay increases pursuant to the OCSEA Collective Bargaining Agreement
Employee Tuition reimbursement programs
Work/Life Balance
The opportunity to work on an important mission
Official Position Description:
Independently oversees & manages complex survey projects &/or prepares legal descriptions & boundary/centerline plats for easements, sale, lease or transfer of land & reviews, signs & certifies right-of-way plans, survey plats, & other documents as Professional Land Surveyor. Coordinates & enforces complex plan/project priorities, policies & methodologies; coordinates project activities with other offices; oversees projects & communicates with consultants, utilities, federal, state & local agencies, general public &/or property owners to obtain project specific information (e.g., parol evidence, property lines, corner monuments); interviews property owners to gather information needed for survey; communicates plan/project purposes with general public. Provides advice/guidance to higher-level administrators in areas such as consultant management, public trust lands, submerged lands &/or boundary line retracement; coordinates plan/project activities with other offices; coordinates with & advises consultant surveyors on survey requirements & oversees preparation of survey drawings & calculations using a computer & related design software. Uses a computer & related software (e.g., Microsoft Office) & prepares legal descriptions & gathers & assembles exhibits for public & court use (e.g., gathers factual data in boundary disputes); testifies in court regarding methods used, final product & related issues; meets with public, property owners & public officials regarding surveys, existing & proposed right of way plans &/or acquisition of property; stays abreast of new technology & developments as relates to position.

Operates, maintains & calibrates survey instruments (e.g., total stations, GPS receivers, digital levels); monitors & accounts for factors pertaining to GPS surveying (e.g., solar storms, atmospheric interference, radio & cellular interference); performs field calculations; keeps notes & records of survey data obtained; determines acceptable quality of recorded survey positions. Uploads, downloads & organizes digital survey data; performs office calculations, data processing, coordinate computations, traverse adjustment & coordinate system transformations; organizes, digitizes & categorizes survey data, records & archives; analyzes survey data via statistical, algebraic & geometrical methods (e.g., standard deviations, area, volume, curves, spiral curves, vertical curves, coordinate geometry, least squares adjustments, elevations, traverse closure); calculates sources of error to identify &/or correct random, systematic & procedural errors in survey measurements; resolves discrepancies in deeds & surveys; produces survey base maps for engineering projects from topographic & planimetric & photogrammetric survey data using a computer & related design software; identifies tree species & other vegetation for environmental preservation, economic reimbursements & safety factors. Researches state, county & city public records (e.g., maps, property deeds, surveys, highway plans, city plans, subdivision plats) &/or utility companies, private engineering firms & surveying firms to provide detailed information for further analysis.

Operates state vehicles (e.g., trucks, vans) to transport equipment, instruments & personnel to project sites; carries field equipment & instruments through rough terrain (e.g., across creeks, up/down hills, over fences, through marshes); clears brush as required to facilitate surveying operations with appropriate equipment (e.g., machete, brush hook); operates hand tools & small equipment (e. g., posthole digger, sledgehammer, spud bar, jackhammer, power auger). Performs other work-related duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Licensure: Current registration as professional surveyor pursuant to section 4733.02 of Ohio Revised Code; valid driver's license.
&
Experience: 12 mos. exp. as Surveyor 2, 85562 OR 12 mos. exp. in responsible charge of survey projects

Knowledge of: professional surveying; OSHA & agency safety practices*; employee training & development*; public relations*; real estate law*; ODOT Survey Standards, ODOT Policies, Minimum Standards for Boundary Surveys pursuant to Section 4733-37 of the Ohio Administrative Code; 3-D point clouds*; photogrammetry*; Ohio State Plane Coordinate Systems. Skill in: operation & maintenance of survey instruments (e.g., total stations, GPS, digital levels, field data collectors); operation of state vehicles (e.g., trucks, vans); operation of hand tools & small equipment (e.g., machete, brush hook, posthole digger, sledgehammer, spud bar, jackhammer, power auger); use of computer, electronic data processing software (e.g., CADD, COGO, GPS, GIS) & word processing software (e.g., Microsoft Office). Ability to: define problems, collect data, establish facts & draw valid conclusions; use geometry & trigonometry; use proper research methods in gathering data; gather, collate & classify information about data, people or things; handle sensitive inquiries from & contacts with officials & general public; lift up to 50 lbs. of equipment.
(*) Developed after employment.

Valid driver's license required.
Certificate of Registration as Professional Surveyor required.
ALL ANSWERS TO THE SUPPLEMENTAL QUESTIONS MUST BE SUPPORTED BY THE WORK EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION PROVIDED ON YOUR CIVIL SERVICE APPLICATION.
All bargaining unit and exempt new hires to ODOT must serve a one year probationary period.
This position is overtime eligible per FLSA Standards.
If this position is filled internally, the wage rate will be determined in accordance with the contract.
All candidates applying for employment opportunities should be authorized to work in the United States. Sponsorship for an employment visa is not currently available for positions with the Ohio Department of Transportation.

Background Check Information

The final candidate selected for the position will be required to undergo a criminal background check. Criminal convictions do not necessarily preclude an applicant from consideration for a position. An individual assessment of an applicant's prior criminal conviction will be made before excluding an applicant from consideration.

eTrac, Inc. is a subsidiary of Woolpert, Inc., which is a cutting-edge national architecture, engineering and geospatial (AEG) firm that delivers value to clients by blending engineering excellence with innovative technology and geospatial applications. Title: Surveyor
Job Description:
We are looking for an individual with heavy civil construction experience to join our construction layout/ survey team. Responsibilities will include laying out for our grading, utility, and concrete divisions using GPS and robotic total stations.
This role requires experience with heavy civil construction and plan reading. Familiarity with engineering instruments and knowledge of GPS and GIS systems is preferred but not required. To succeed as a layout team member, you should have a thorough understanding of heavy civil construction with an emphasis in concrete structural and architectural disciplines.
If you meet our criteria, and if you’re also organized and detail-oriented with a strong experience in this field, we would like to hear from you.
Responsibilities:
Travel to Job sites in a timely and responsible fashion
Conduct layout on various sites
Examine plan sets to ensure data accuracy
Use equipment and tools to accurately measure proposed improvements
Record measurements for QC and as-builts
Requirements and Skills
Aptitude in math and problem-solving
Attention to detail
Great organizational and leadership skills
Ability to work outdoors in physically demanding conditions
Valid Driver License is required
Ability to lift 25lbs or more
Capable of reading and comprehending schematics and blueprints
Benefits
Dental Insurance
Health Insurance
Paid time off
401 k plans
Vision Insurance

Title: Surveyor and Mapping Technician
Job Description:
Surveyor and Mapping Technician

Who We Are
At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!
Our Business
We are a global leader in environmental consulting - made stronger with the recent acquisition of Wood’s Environment & Infrastructure business and Golder - with world-class expertise in environmental, social and governance (ESG), climate resiliency & sustainability (CRS), and earth sciences. Combined we have over 20,000 multidisciplinary professionals worldwide collaborating daily to protect and conserve natural landscapes, create firm foundations for communities to stand on, and champion sustainable development to combat climate change. As part of the team, you will have access to an unparalleled network of resources and endless opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects with diverse teammates from across the globe.
This Opportunity
WSP is currently seeking an enthusiastic and energetic Surveying and Mapping Technician to assist professional staff in the planning, execution and delivery of surveying and mapping projects and related deliverable products.
Your Impact
Must be able to multi-task relating to projects and deliverable products
Maintain flexible schedule to prioritize and meet deadlines
Evaluate, process, and map traditional field notes, electronic data collection, and GPS/GNSS files
Provide technical mapping support in production of deliverable surveying and mapping products
Prepare CAD deliverables to client specific standards
Perform survey computations and adjustments
Interpret and map legal descriptions
Prepare legal descriptions and sketches
Records research
Willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies
Who You Are
Required Qualifications
High School Diploma or equivalent
2 years of experience working in the surveying and mapping profession
Demonstrated proficiency with computer systems and basic office software
Demonstrated proficiency and working knowledge of AutoCAD Civil 3D and/or MicroStation/GEOPAK, and GIS
Good communication skills
Good time management skills
Quality control oriented with attention to detail
Knowledge of and experience in field survey procedures
Knowledge of and experience in survey computations and adjustments
Knowledge of boundary survey principles
Ability and wiliness to occasionally work in the field
NSPS Certified Survey Technician (CST) certification or ability to procure in 6 months
Valid driver’s license and must pass background check
#LI-RR1

Additional Requirements
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.
Additional Details
Travel Required: 50%
Job Status: Regular
Employee Type: Full
Primary Location: ORLANDO - CANAL RD
All locations: US-FL-Orlando
About WSP
WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of WSP, one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the buildings, transportation, energy, water and environment markets. With more than 15,000 employees in over 300 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com
WSP provides a flexible, agile and hybrid workplace model while meeting client needs. Employees are also afforded a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.
At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Your daily contributions to your team will be essential in meeting client objectives, goals and challenges. Are you ready to get started?
WSP USA (and all of its U.S. companies) is an Equal Opportunity Employer Race/Age/Color/Religion/Sex/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/National Origin/Disability or Protected Veteran Status.
The selected candidate must be authorized to work in the United States.

Title: SITE ASSESSOR/SURVEYOR
Job Description:
ACE Solar is hiring a Site Assessor to conduct site surveys for Solar PV projects. This is a full-time position with benefits and great opportunities for career development and growth. No experience is needed. We will train the right candidate.
ACE Solar is a leading solar company based in Massachusetts that works throughout New England. ACE Solar is rapidly growing and has been ranked #1 Residential Solar Company in MA for 4 years running. Join our fun, fast-paced, and motivated team!
Education and Training Level
Job Duties
Conduct a physical site survey using a variety of company provided tools and equipment
Fill out site surveying sheets needed by the Engineering Department to produce permit-ready documents, uploading data to the project management system.
Measure roof planes, vents, dormers, and chimneys
Assess shading – take Suneye measurements of roofs
Draw, document, and photograph roofs
Upload site assessment documentation into cloud storage software and CRM
Effectively manage your schedule to complete time-sensitive tasks on a daily basis.
Complete site surveys for solar panel installations
Accessing, assessing, photographing, and measuring roofs
Maintain a consistent schedule of appointments
Upload data and report to the Design team
Pick up permits
Attend inspections
Commitment to understanding and facilitating the solar design process in order to make sure projects are accurately designed/built
Perform other tasks and duties as required
Job Requirements
High school diploma or equivalent
Must be willing to travel
Comfortable with heights/ladders and working outside
Create site sketches with accurate data
Measure and record data
Able to open live electrical panels
Able to interact effectively with customers
Detail-oriented
Must be able to lift heavy objects (50 lbs. or more)
Valid Driver’s license
Proficiency with smartphone applications and digital cameras
Prior experience (preferred but not required)
Solar panel installation
Electrical
OSHA 10 certification
Roofing construction
Experience with Solmetric SunEye, SolarPathfinder and related programs
Benefits
Paid Time Off (PTO), 401k, Competitive salary, bonus plan, contribution to a health plan, life insurance, and long-term disability plan.
Job Type: Full-time

Employment inquiries can be sent to hiring@myacesolar.com.

Title: Project Coordinator
Job Description:
Project Coordinator
Company Name: CHW Professional Consultants
Location: Gainesville, FL
Position Title: Project Coordinator
Job Type: Full-Time
Industry: Civil Engineering – Construction Administration/Construction Engineering Inspections
Min Education: High School Diploma
Experience: Mid-Level
Required Travel: 0-10%
For over 30 years, CHW has been transforming communities through positive change, concept to construction. CHW is an experienced professional consulting firm built around a team of land planners, urban designers, landscape architects, land surveyors, civil engineers, ecologists, and construction engineering inspectors and administrators.
We also place great importance on our core company values of integrity, excellence, responsibility, stewardship, and dedication while being passionate client advocates dedicated to improving and growing communities.
Position Summary
The Project Coordinator will support the Project Manager(s) and Construction Services Department Director. Duties and tasks will include tracking and processing RFIs and shop drawings, project closeout, issuance of plan revisions, tracking of projects in construction, scheduling meetings, preparing reports, memos, and other related documents. Additional activities will consist of general office related tasks including scheduling, filing, typing, scanning, and copying.
Main Responsibilities (but not limited to) the following:
Professionally represent the firm in interactions with local municipalities and governing agencies, clients, peer organizations, and business associates
Communicate proactively and appropriately with team members, local municipalities and governing agencies, clients, sub-consultants, and others as needed
Act as a team player, fulfilling your own responsibilities and supporting others, including occasionally performing additional responsibilities as needed to help the team meet deadlines and complete tasks
Prepare various types of documents for company use, team use, client use, for submittal to agencies, and for other end users
Research agency requirements for project closeout and associated activities
Handle meeting scheduling, and calendar milestones and appointments
Conduct other non-project administrative functions, in support of the team, Project Manager, Department Director, Department VP, or other company staff, as needed
Complete job responsibilities while adhering to CHW Standards and appropriate company procedures and protocols
Conduct responsibilities while adhering to Core Values and CHW Standards
Complete all job functions proactively and independently with minimal input or direction from other staff
Knowledge / Skill Set:
Teamwork skills
Excellent communication skills
Ability to work independently and proactively
Persistence
Prioritization and time management skills
Excellent organizational skills
Working knowledge of standard office software and good typing skills
Proficiency in the following software and skills:
Microsoft Office suite and Project (or similar scheduling/management software), Adobe Acrobat, and the internet
Office equipment (copiers, printers, binding machine, etc.)
Education / Other Requirements:
High School Diploma and minimum of 5 years of professional experience or an AA or AS degree with a minimum of 2 years of professional experience
Valid driver’s license
Must have: Resume
Strongly encouraged: Cover letter
CHW Benefits & Perks:
Medical, Dental, & Vision coverage options
Profit Sharing
401(k) Plan and Match
Company furnished life insurance and long-term disability insurance
Voluntary benefits options including FSA, short-term disability, and discounted Pet Insurance
Combined PTO (personal & sick)
Paid Annual Company Holidays
Professional Development & Career Growth Opportunities
Tuition Reimbursement Program
Employee Referral & Service Anniversary Bonus
Volunteer & Team Engagement Opportunities
Passion. Empowers. Progress. At CHW, it is our desire to work with passionate, progressive talent to ensure the highest quality of services to our clients. As a full-service firm, we utilize a team approach that involves all disciplines. We present both a creative and technical approach to the delivery of our projects. But there is more to working with CHW: optimism, energy, and confidence. Whether you are an experienced professional or a recent graduate, you will have the chance to collaborate with the best and brightest in the industry, while working on a portfolio of innovative and challenging projects, ones to be proud of. With a sharp mind, you can go far. But if your heart is in the right place too, you are unstoppable. That is how we define passion. It is advocating for our clients, our community, and each other that spurs growth and allows everyone to move forward.
CHW Embraces Diversity. We believe in creating an inclusive environment and it’s an essential part of our culture. We’re committed to implementing our Diversity Policy and we expect all employees to treat each other equally, honestly and with respect.

Title: UAS Surveryor
Job Description:
ASN Constructors is a joint venture of three international contractors (Acciona, Shikun & Binui and North American Construction Group) who will work with the Metro Flood Diversion Authority and other area stakeholders to build a historic project that will protect the citizens of the Fargo-Moorhead area from flood waters from the Red River. We will provide value to our employees through craft training programs, competitive benefits and a safe work environment and value to the local community with outstanding project quality and opportunity for employment and training programs.
The UAS Surveyor is a hybrid field & office position that will assist our sUAS and Survey staff. This individual will help collect survey data using airborne and terrestrial tools. This individual will also utilize software to process collected data. This position will report to the Survey Manager and acts as a key member of the survey and technical office, with critical coordination with the Drone Program Manager, along with Field survey and CAD Staff.
Responsibilities:
· Acquire airborne data using various UAS systems and be willing to learn/master these systems.
· Acquire terrestrial data using various Trimble systems such as Total Station, Terrestrial scanner, and GPS and be willing to learn/master these systems.
· Ensure safe and secure use of company equipment and instrumentation.
· Conduct pre-flight processes such as: UAV assembly, pre-flight planning, safety briefings, airspace coordination, checklists, and be responsible for overall mission-readiness.
· Conduct post-flight processes such as: UAV equipment tear-down, post mission documentation, equipment maintenance & storage.
· Conduct Pre and Post collection checks on terrestrial data processes.
· Pre-process & deliver collected survey data to our post processing and engineering teams using multiple software packages.
· Troubleshoot, Calibrate, and Maintain instrumentation.
· Troubleshoot data/software issues related to the hardware/software and the deliverables.
· Perform quality control checks of collected raw and pre-processed data to ensure accuracy and that the client's needs will be met.
· QC/QA data against control and historical collections.
· Analyze current and historical data for classification and change analysis.
Minimum Qualifications:
· A valid driver's license.
· FAA Commercial Drone Certification (Part 107 or equivalent) or ability to obtain within first 30 days of employment.
· Ability to lift and carry 50+ pounds for 300 feet or more.
· Ability to traverse rough, slippery, and soft terrains.
· Vision sufficient for airspace scanning and monitoring during flight.
· Excellent written and verbal skills in English.
· Demonstrate advanced teamwork skills.
· Basic understanding of geospatial concepts.
· Basic understanding of GPS & conventional survey methods.
Preferred Qualifications:
· Greater than 6 months field experience in multiple climates.
· Documented flight hours above 100 on various sUAS platforms.
· Ability to pilot sUAS to a safe landing unaided by flight stabilization or automation.
· Broad experience in GIS based software such as ArcPRO, Google Earth or similar.
· Advanced ability in software like: Trimble Business Center, Agisoft Metashape, or Civil 3D.
· An inquisitive, and eager to learn / develop mindset.
· Conversational Spanish.
· Deep familiarity of global and national units of measurement.
ASN Constructors and all its affiliate companies are proud to be Equal Opportunity Employers.
Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:
401(k)
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Life insurance
Paid time off
Vision insurance
Experience:
sUAS: 1 year (Required)
License/Certification:
FAA Commercial Drone Certification (Part 107 or equivalent) (Required)
Work Location: One location

Health insurance

Title: Office Surveyor
Job Description:
Job Description:
Dewberry is currently seeking an experienced Office Surveyor. Applicant must be responsible, highly motivated, and a detail-oriented individual interested in joining our Land Surveying department as a Land Survey Computer. Applicant must be able to work in a team environment as a key member of a professional surveying staff assisting in the performance of boundary, ALTA, topographic, platting, right-of way acquisition, transmission line, transportation, and construction surveys utilizing the latest equipment and surveying technology.

This position has opportunity for advancement for a motivated individual willing to grow with the changing skills and technology required of a Professional Land Surveyor.

Dewberry is a leading, market-facing professional services firm with more than 50 locations and 2,000 professionals nationwide. What sets us apart from our competitors are our people. At Dewberry, we seek out exceptional talent and strive to deliver the highest quality of services to our clients. Whether you’re an experienced professional or a new graduate, you’ll have the chance to collaborate with the best and brightest and work on innovative and complex projects at the forefront of the industry. Our commitment to excellence stems from our personal integrity and from other defining attributes, which we call “Dewberry at Work,” that have inspired our employees to be successful for more than a half-century.
Responsibilities:
Assist the survey project manager with all aspects of the daily office workload.
Communicate with the office / field coordinator with daily workload and needs to meet the schedule.
Scheduling and communicating workload status to Project Manager in order to meet all deadlines.
Daily uploading and downloading of data collectors and reduction of files.
Survey computations for boundary and topographic surveys and construction stakeout.
Drafting of Boundary, ALTA, topographic, house location surveys and record plats.
Continually advance knowledge with upgrades with software and technology.
Work independently as a one-person field crew or assist field crew as required.
Recognize and work in a safe manner to comply with all safety regulations.
Cutsheet preparation on a daily or as needed basis.
Required Skills & Required Experience:
College degree preferred.
Must have High School Diploma.
Minimum of three (3) years of survey experience preferred.
Must have good verbal and written communication skills.
Must have strong AutoCAD drafting and computing skills.
Must be able to work overtime as required.
Must be willing and able to do short term travel.
Must be proficient with land record research.
Must be able to work independently.
Must have diverse survey experience including: Boundary surveys, topographic surveys, GPS control surveys, construction stakeout for residential and commercial projects and cutsheets.
Must have a valid driver’s license, good driving record and ability to pass a driving record background check.
Must pass a mandatory drug test.
Proficient with Carlson Survey, Carlson SurvCE and Trimble Business Center software is a plus.
Proficient with Bentley (Microstation) skills is a plus.
Experience with VDOT surveys is a plus.
Experience with laser scanning is a plus.
Experience with 3D survey drawings a plus.
Experience with Civil 3D a plus.
Ability to obtain a security clearance is a plus.
In accordance with applicable Executive Order 14042 and related requirements, all prospective hires for this position, performing work for the federal government, will be required to demonstrate that they have been fully vaccinated for COVID-19, or qualify for an exemption to this vaccination requirement. Such proof of vaccination, or written request for exemption, will be required, following receipt of written offer.

Don’t meet every single requirement? At Dewberry we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace for our employee’s. So if you’re excited about this role, but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the position description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may just be the right candidate for this or other opportunities.

At this time, Dewberry will not sponsor a new applicant for work authorization.
Dewberry is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, gender identity or sexual orientation.
Only recipients of an offer of employment from Dewberry, will be required to submit to a background screening which may include, but is not limited to, employment verification, educational and other credential verification, driving record check, criminal background check, and an investigative consumer report. These screenings will be conducted by Dewberry’s background vendor of choice and will be conducted in compliance with all applicable federal, state, and local law.

Title: Staff Surveyor
Job Description:
Imagine a place where responsibility is shared equally among all employees. Where leaders are approachable, and the open-door policy is the rule. Where employees are tasked to be innovative and work with an entrepreneurial spirit.

Welcome to Manhard Consulting! We see problems as an opportunity for creativity, and we are looking for problem solvers to join our dynamic team. Our firm is organized into small teams to give you a strong sense of accountability and to achieve great results.

Job Summary:
This position must be able to work independently on houseline plats, plat of survey, subdivision plats, plats of easement, plats of dedication, topographic surveys, ALTA surveys, boundary surveys, and block sheets for field crews for construction staking services.

Accountability and Duties:

Provides an accurate accounting of time spent on projects with descriptions for each time entry on a daily basis.
Keeps supervisors informed of work load and any changes in project scope or additional services.
Maintains a good relationship with clients and staff.

Accurately completes block sheets for field crews for construction staking services independently.
Participates in marketing, sales, and business development efforts where or when requested by supervisor.

0-4 years of Field Survey experience

Bachelor’s degree in Surveying or 24 semester hours of college surveying

Valid driver’s license

Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Excellent oral and technical written communication skills.
Strong sense of urgency and self-initiative to meet client deadlines

Available to work overtime as needed to complete projects

Knowledge of industry related software
Proficient with AutoCAD Civil 3D

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to stand/walk, climb/stoop/kneel, lift/pull/push, grasp/feel. Must be able to write, type, and use phone system. Must regularly lift and/or move up to 25 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds, and occasionally lift and/or move up to 100 pounds.

Position subject to possible modification to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities.

Title: Trainee Graduate Land Surveyor
Job Description:
What drives you?

At MnDOT, we are driven to find talented, innovative employees for Minnesota’s nationally recognized transportation system. We work to build the best team in the transportation industry to ensure that Minnesota thrives with a safe, sustainable and leading edge transportation system. You will be surrounded by a diverse community of experts, each driven by challenging work and motivated by the greater good. You will understand the impact of the work you are doing and be able to see the benefit you are providing to the citizens of Minnesota. You can set your sights high and use your strengths to grow within the organization. MnDOT offers superior health and retirement benefits as well as a solid commitment to work-life balance, which provides you the tools to thrive both at work and outside of work.
Job Details

Working Title: Trainee Graduate Land Surveyor
Agency: Minnesota Department of Transportation
This was previously announced and is being re-posted for additional candidates. If you previously applied, you do not need to re-apply.
Who May Apply: Open to all qualified job seekers
Date Posted: 3/15/2023
Closing Date: 4/7/2023
Hiring Agency/Seniority Unit: Transportation Department / Transportation-District 6-MGEC
Division/Unit: Rochester Surveys
Work Shift/Work Hours: Flexible
Days of Work: Monday - Friday
Travel Required: Occasional
Salary Range: $24.14 - $35.63 / hourly
Classified Status: Non-Status
Bargaining Unit/Union: 212 - MN Government Engineers Council/Engineers
Supervisor Name: Desiree Doud
FLSA Status: Exempt - Professional
Telework Eligible: No
Designated in Connect 700 Program for Applicants with Disabilities: No
Make a difference in the lives of Minnesotans.
The work you’ll do is more than just a job. Join the talented, engaged and inclusive workforce dedicated to creating a better Minnesota.
Job Summary

**The Minnesota Department of Transportation does not sponsor applicants for work visas or Optional Practical Training Extensions for STEM Students. Individuals must be legally authorized to work in the US at the start of employment.
The Minnesota Department of Transportation's Graduate Land Surveyor Program is a 2-year rotation program allowing Trainees to gain professional surveying experience by completing short rotations (3 to 6 months) in multiple areas of surveying. Sample rotations include Construction, Legal Descriptions, Platting, Geodetics, or Right of Way.
This vacancy posting will be used to fill two (2) Trainee, Land Surveyor positions in MnDOT's Graduate Land Surveyor Program. These Trainee positions will be homebased in Rochester, MN. The selected Trainee will begin employment in May of 2023 or once all educational requirements have been met. Upon successful completion of the two (2) year training program, the Trainee will be promoted to a Land Surveyor in Training and be permanently assigned to District 6 - Rochester.
To successfully complete the program, a Trainee must: 1) Complete two (2) years of professional surveying experience; 2) Obtain Fundamentals of Surveying (FS) registration; 3) Demonstrate satisfactory performance in all rotations; 4) Complete all required rotations; and 5) Complete 10 hours of recruitment outreach and/or public engagement service. When all criteria are met the Trainee will be non-competitively promoted to a Land Surveyor in Training position. Failure to meet any of these requirements may result in termination.
Additionally, all Trainees must become a registered, Professional Surveyor within 6 years of being appointed as a Trainee, no exceptions. Failure to do so may result in termination.
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications
To receive credit for your education and experience, your resume should clearly describe how you meet each minimum and/or preferred qualification listed, including dates of employment.
To qualify for MnDOT's Graduate Land Surveyor Program, applicants must possess, at a minimum, a Bachelor of Science in Surveying from an ABET accredited college, or a bachelor’s degree in a closely related field that includes at least 22 semester hours of surveying curriculum, by the date of hire. If the selected candidate has not yet obtained their bachelor’s degree, all offers of employment will be contingent upon successful completion of this educational requirement.
A GPA of at least 2.5;
and
A Valid class D Driver's License
In addition to electronically applying to this vacancy at https://mn.gov/mmb/careers/, all qualified applicants must complete the application requirements by emailing the following information to Desiree Doud at Desiree.Doud@state.mn.us by the close of this posting on April 7, 2023.
Failure to submit your transcripts and all supporting documentation will result in an incomplete application and you will be removed from any further consideration for these positions. Please submit the following:
1) Your education transcripts (All transcripts related to your qualifying degree or surveying certificate)
2) Proof of any identifying credentials (Proof of FS certification, Proof of PS licensure)
3) If your degree is from a foreign university and you have not yet passed the Fundamentals of Surveying (FS) exam in the US, you must also supply proof that your degree meets the equivalent of a Bachelor of Science in Surveying and that once you meet the professional experience requirement you would be eligible to become a licensed surveyor in the state of Minnesota.
4) Please include your first and last name in the subject line of the email and also indicate what is included in the email, i.e., Jane Doe – Transcripts and FS proof
Preferred Qualifications
Survey crew chief
Grad Point Average of 3.0 or higher
Fundamental of Surveying registration (LSIT)
MnDOT or Minnesota municipalities (city/county) surveying experience
Additional Requirements
REFERENCE/BACKGROUND CHECKS:
**Successful candidate must pass past-employer reference checks and criminal history check**
It is our policy that all candidates submit to a background investigation prior to employment. The background check may consist of the following components:
SEMA4 Records Check
Criminal History Check
Employment Reference Check
Education/License Verification
Driver's License Check
Application Details
How to Apply
Select “Apply for Job” at the top of this page. If you have questions about applying for jobs, contact the job information line at 651-259-3637 or email careers@state.mn.us. For additional information about the application process, go to http://www.mn.gov/careers.
If you have questions about the position, contact Desiree Doud at Desiree.Doud@state.mn.us.
Why Work for Us
Diverse Workforce
We are committed to continually developing a workforce that reflects the diversity of our state and the populations we serve. The varied experiences and perspectives of employees strengthen the work we do together and our ability to best serve the people of Minnesota.
A recent engagement survey of State of Minnesota employees found:
95% of employees understand how their work helps achieve their agency’s mission
91% of employees feel trusted to do their jobs
88% of employees feel equipped to look at situations from other cultural perspectives when doing their job
87% of employees report flexibility in their work schedule
Comprehensive Benefits
Our benefits aim to balance four key elements that make life and work meaningful: health and wellness, financial well-being, professional development, and work/life harmony. As an employee, your benefits may include:
Public pension plan
Training and professional development
Paid vacation and sick leave
11 paid holidays each year
Paid parental leave
Low-cost medical and dental coverage
Prescription drug coverage
Vision coverage
Wellness programs and resources
Employer paid life insurance
Short-term and long-term disability
Health care spending and savings accounts
Dependent care spending account
Tax-deferred compensation
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Tuition reimbursement
Federal Public Service Student Loan Forgiveness Program
Programs, resources and benefits eligibility varies based on type of employment, agency, funding availability, union/collective bargaining agreement, location, and length of service with the State of Minnesota.
AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
Minnesota state agencies are equal opportunity, affirmative action, and veteran-friendly employers. The State of Minnesota recognizes that a diverse workforce is essential and strongly encourages qualified women, minorities, individuals with disabilities, and veterans to apply.
We will make reasonable accommodations to all qualified applicants with disabilities. If you are an individual with a disability who needs assistance or cannot access the online job application system, please contact the job information line at 651-259-3637 or email careers@state.mn.us and indicate what assistance is needed.
Minnesota Department of Transportation (MnDOT) encourages participation in all its programs, services and activities and does not discriminate against qualified applicants with disabilities. Anyone who believes they may need a reasonable accommodation in order to fully participate in the job application, interview or selection processes may contact any agency official with whom applicant has contact in the processing of their employment application to request an accommodation. Applicants may also contact the MnDOT Affirmative Action office to request an accommodation by: E-mail: ADArequest.dot@state.mn.us; or by calling Janet Miller at 651/366-4720; or using MN Relay 711.
The MnDOT Reasonable Accommodation policy can be found at: http://www.dot.state.mn.us/policy/hr/hr009.html.

Title: CHIEF SURVEYOR FOR CONSTRUCTION
Job Description:
Are you interested in an environment where leaders foster a culture based on respect for people and continuous improvement? ADOT leaders model a collaborative, problem-solving, and coaching-based culture focused on employee engagement and development. Leaders are accountable, transparent, and communicative as they sustain an inclusive, diverse, and safe environment. ADOT leaders are visible and present, demonstrating: We are Connecting Arizona
This position serves as an Engineering Chief Surveyor and reports to the Engineering Survey Section Manager. This position is responsible for providing leadership, management, supervision and direction through oversight of the scheduling, planning, execution and delivery of all survey services performed by assigned survey personnel for either the planning/design level or construction survey services tasks. Additional services include: review of scoping and design/construction documentation; operating survey field equipment and utilizing Computer Aided Drafting and Design (CADD) and other software to process survey data; communicating with design, project management, and construction personnel;and reviewing/checking work before it is delivered to ensure completeness and compliance with survey requirements and the scope of work.
Model ADOT values through leading, coaching and developing problem solvers to implement and sustain a continuous improvement culture. Leaders are accountable, transparent, and communicative as they foster an inclusive, diverse, and safe environment.
The State of Arizona strives for a work culture that affords employees flexibility, autonomy, and trust. Across our many agencies, boards, commissions, many State employees participate in the State’s Remote Work Program and are able to work remotely in their homes, in offices, and in hoteling spaces. All work, including remote work, should be performed within Arizona, unless an exception is properly authorized in advance.
Job Duties:
Essential Duties and Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Plan, Execute and Deliver required planning level or construction field survey tasks in support of the delivery of roadway design and construction related projects. This includes, but is not limited to the survey of centerline horizontal and vertical control networks, cross-section, terrain modeling, and earthwork quantities.
Provide and review construction related survey services related to, but not limited to placement of structures, rights-of-way, earthwork quantities, signing, traffic control.
ListPerform critical and complex survey related calculations, including processing data, control verification and other alignment/boundary data calculations. Review and verify the survey data prepared by ADOT or consultant surveyors and carry out Quality Assurance/Quality Control (QA/QC) established procedures.
Coordinates and communicates with project design, management and construction personnel, reviewing project documentation and performing on-site reviews of projects prior to and during design and/or construction to assist in the design, pre-construction and construction survey field work.
Management and supervision duties include: planning, scheduling, directing, training staff for maximum productivity, performing performance reviews and coaching, hiring, disciplinary actions, and ensuring safety needs are met.
Evaluate and provide recommendations for survey software, hardware, equipment and training needs in the section.
Participate in project meetings and provide clear and timely communication and coordination with ADOT, consultant and contractors to provide input on project survey needs and cost proposals, surveying related issues, resource and project scheduling.
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities (KSAs):
Knowledge of:
Principles and practices of civil engineering, geodetic and land surveying as applied to design, development and construction of the state highway system
Control, Location and Construction field survey practices, procedures, standards, and requirements
Photogrammetric mapping procedures and related applications
Use and capabilities of field survey equipment, software and CADD computer applications as they pertain to survey
Computational and adjustment factors applied in the review and analysis of engineering and/or field surveying data related to the area of assignment
Federal and state statutes, agency standards, regulations, policies and procedures pertaining to land surveying
Principles and practices of work leadership and management, supervision, and training
Public, agency and personal safety standards, policies, and procedures

Skills in:
Oral and written communication and project management
Performing complex and critical survey calculations including control, alignments, and other data conversion calculations
Leadership, supervision and team management
Researching and interpreting a wide variety of highly technical engineering and survey data
Listening and problem solving, personnel management, and employee relationship
Computer application and computer aided analysis and design package utilization
Operating a wide variety of surveying equipment
Google Suite

Ability to:
Communicate clearly and concisely with a wide range of professional, governmental representatives, the public, the ability to respond to verbal questions from the public or governmental representatives
Analytic and interpretive abilities to understand and apply complex state and federal regulations relating to highway development
Analyze and evaluate a wide variety of engineering and survey data and the ability to develop and implement appropriate standards, procedures, priorities for assigned work
Effectively communicate in written and verbal form
Conduct meetings and presentations to a variety of audiences and achieve consensus on key issues as necessary
Independent thinking and ability to apply judgement in abstract situations
Work outdoors for extended time, exposed to heat, cold, dust, noise
Coach and develop employees, including continuous improvement practices and principles
Selective Preference(s):
The ideal candidate for this position will have:

A Bachelors of Science in Civil Engineering, Surveying or closely related field, and various employer training courses and seminars relevant to this position AND a minimum of 10 years of field survey experience AND 2-5 years experience supervising a survey work unit or survey crew.

Pre-Employment Requirements:
This position requires registration as a Registered Land Surveyor (RLS) in the State of Arizona or proof of eligibility of reciprocity.

This position requires possession of a valid Arizona Class D Driver License. Candidates for this position must complete and sign PART 1 of the State of Arizona Application for Employment at the time of interview, which will allow ADOT to obtain the candidate's motor vehicle record (MVR). The most recent 39-month period shown on the MVR will be reviewed in accordance with A.A.C. R2-10-207.11 (H) and (I). The review must show an acceptable driving record prior to any offer of employment being made by ADOT. Employment is contingent upon an acceptable MVR.
Benefits:
The Arizona Department of Administration offers a comprehensive benefits package to include:
Sick leave
Vacation with 10 paid holidays per year
Health and dental insurance
Retirement plan
Life insurance and long-term disability insurance
Optional employee benefits include short-term disability insurance, deferred compensation plans, and supplemental life insurance

For a complete list of benefits provided by The State of Arizona, please visit our benefits page
By providing the option of a full-time or part-time remote work schedule, employees enjoy improved work/life balance, report higher job satisfaction, and are more productive. Remote work is a management option and not an employee entitlement or right. An agency may terminate a remote work agreement at its discretion.
Retirement:
Participation in the Arizona State Retirement System (ASRS) is required.
Contact Us:
Arizona State Government is an EOE/ADA Reasonable Accommodation Employer. Persons with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation such as a sign language interpreter or an alternative format by calling (602) 712-7279. Requests should be made as early as possible to allow sufficient time to arrange the accommodation. ADOT is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All newly hired employees will be subject to E-Verify Employment Eligibility Verification.

Title: Survey/Laser Scanner Technician
Job Description:
C.T. Male Associates, a multi-discipline surveying, engineering, and architectural firm in the Northeast, is seeking to fill a Survey/Laser Scanner Technician position in our Latham, NY office. Come collaborate with a team of technical professionals and join a community that will strive to help you reach your greatest potential.
As a Survey/Laser Scanner Technician at C.T. Male Associates, you will coordinate all aspects of Laser Scanner Services. You must have complete knowledge of Laser Scanner terminology, hardware, and software. This full-time position offers a competitive compensation package as well as advancement opportunities.
Responsibilities:
Setup and execute field procedures, review data, recognize errors, perform computations, and implement procedures, including quality control and quality assurance.
Plan and schedule office and field operations for GPS, Laser Scanner, and conventional survey projects.
Utilize Leica Geosystems HDS Cyclone Mapping/Modeling software to process and manage point cloud data and transfer data into AutoCAD Civil 3D for mapping purposes.
Prepare boundary computations under the direction of a Licensed Land Surveyor.
Secure information from Public Corporations, Government Agencies, utility companies and other surveyors including deed research.
Direct and instruct Survey field staff engaged in making various types of field surveys.
Understand and protract deeds, maps, and easements with all proper notations.
Perform computations for construction stakeout to include horizontal curves, vertical curves, house/lot stakeout and utility data.
Perform mathematical calculations to establish and locate property corners, vertical and horizontal reference points, and staking for construction projects.
Be able to download a GPS receiver/data collector and process the collected data in Trimble Business Center.
Requirements:
A.A.S. Degree in Surveying Technology or certificate from college or technical school; and five plus (5+) years related experience and/or equivalent combination of training, education and/or experience.
Complete knowledge of surveying and laser scanner terminology.
Knowledge of compatible uses of conventional methods and GPS.
Full understanding of contour plotting.
Current Remote UAV Pilot Part 107 Certificate is strongly preferred.
Familiarity with utility mapping.
Ability to comfortably lift and walk several feet carrying up to 75 lbs. of equipment.
OSHA 40-Hour HAZWOPER training is a plus.
OSHA 10-Hour Construction Health and Safety training is a plus.
Valid driver's license.
Pay Range: $25.00 - $35.00 per hour, commensurate with experience and qualifications.
Come join a company where your talents and motivation are rewarded; please apply here: Survey/Laser Scanner Technician
At C.T. Male Associates, we embrace diversity and inclusion. We are committed to building a team with a variety of backgrounds, skills, and views. Our intent is to foster an environment where people of different backgrounds can contribute at their highest level and where their differences can make a positive impact on our firm, our clients, and our communities.
C.T. Male Associates is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and affirmative action employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications. We invite all qualified applicants to be considered for employment regardless of race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the law.

Title: Survey Project Manager (2+ Years PM Experience)
Job Description:
Survey Project Manager (2+ Years PM Experience; Local Candidates Only; Hybrid)
MWM DesignGroup is looking for a self-directed and proven Surveying Project Manager experienced with public and private sector projects. .
You’ll have the opportunity to manage survey projects, engage with designers on public infrastructure and land development projects, working with our team of civil engineers, architects, and landscape architects. If you are looking for growth opportunities in your career while working in a great team environment, then come join us at MWM DesignGroup!
We offer variety in our work. Recent and ongoing design projects include higher education, K-12, recreational, civic, transit, horizontal mixed-use and commercial.
Here’s what we’d like to see on your resume:
2+ years of experience as a Survey Project Manager; 2+ years as a Project Surveyor/Coordinator
Registration as a Professional Surveyor in Texas; RPLS
Proficiency in project management, including preparation and negotiation of survey proposals
Desire to work with others in a team-oriented culture
Ablilty to communicate well with clients
Experience with Civil 3D and Microsoft Word & Excel
Ability to lift 40 lbs.
MWM DesignGroup outcompetes larger companies with an expert and enthusiastic team. Our industry-leading talent focuses on enjoying our work. We promote and thrive in a culture of helpfulness and mentorship. A career at MWM DesignGroup is a place where your work will make a difference and where we will help you get to that next level of professional accomplishment.
If you enjoy working in a team environment and collaborating with other professionals including architects, engineers, and permitting expeditors to design high-impact projects that define our community - then come join us at MWM DesignGroup!
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: From $85,000.00 per year
Benefits:

Employee assistance program

Health insurance

Work from home during the pandemic. MWM provides flexibility to keep you safe and technology to keep you working even in the most uncertain of times. We use technology such as Microsoft Teams and OneNote. Home office stipend available.

Experience with Civil 3D and Microsoft Word & Excel

RPLS (Required)
