Health insurance

Title: Chief Deputy Surveyor
Job Description:
CLASSIFICATION TITLE: CHIEF DEPUTY SURVEYOR
CLASSIFICATION NUMBER: 073
CLASSIFFICATION CATEGORY: MANAGEMENT/EXEMPT
DEPARTMENT: Linn County Surveyor’s Office
GENERAL JOB DUTIES: Perform supervisory and advanced technical survey work in making land and road
surveys and re-establishing section or designated land claim corners. Serve as the County Surveyor's principle
assistant.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE JOB:
Assign, coordinate, supervise and perform survey field work.
Provide training for field survey personnel for improved efficiency and accuracy in performing work.
Coordinate right-of-way survey work with the various district supervisors in the Road Department.
Insure that survey work or survey-related projects are properly surveyed and are performed in a timely
fashion.
Process raw field data into a survey map which will be filed as a Linn County Survey.
Evaluate existing deed descriptions on roads and properties owned by Linn County or others.
Inspect each job prior to assigning work crews. Inspect jobs for progress and to resolve any questions or
problems.
Assume responsibilities delegated by the County Surveyor in the absence of the County Surveyor.
QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
Thorough knowledge of the principles and practices of surveying as applied to county land surveying projects.
Thorough knowledge of the operation and maintenance of surveying equipment. Thorough knowledge of
surveying techniques, principles and practices. Considerable knowledge of records maintenance systems. Skill in
the use of survey and office equipment.
Five years of progressively responsible surveying experience with four years of experience in a supervisory
capacity; four years of college level coursework in surveying or civil engineering; or any satisfactory equivalent
combination of experience, education and training which demonstrates the ability to perform the work described.
Possession of a valid Oregon Professional Land Surveyor’s License. Possession of a valid Oregon Motor Vehicle
Operator's License and an acceptable driving record.
SALARY, BENEFITS, COMPENSATION: Linn County offers an excellent benefits package which includes fully paid
contribution to the Oregon Public Employees Retirement System, paid holiday, vacation and sick leave, options for
medical, dental and vision care insurance, options for deferred compensation, an employee assistance program,
longevity pay, alternate and flexible work schedules and more. Current salary range and total compensation
(depending on qualifications):

SALARY RANGE: $5,836 - $7,368 per month
CLOSING DATE: OPEN UNTIL FILLED
HOW TO APPLY: Submit a completed Linn County Employment Application Form along with a resume and cover
letter to: Thomas J. Casey, Linn County Surveyor, PO Box 100, Albany, Oregon 97321; FAX: 541-967-3801.
Application forms may be obtained, along with the Job Classification, at the Linn County webpage www.co.linn.or.us.

LINN COUNTY IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY/AFFIRMATIVE ACTION EMPLOYER

Title: Contract Route & Litter Control Supervisor - "Open Till Filled"
Job Description:
DESCRIPTION
“Open Till Filled”
This position is responsible for daily supervision and Compliance of the Solid Waste Collection Contract and Area-wide Litter Control. The Route Supervisor is responsible for monitoring & compliance of the waste collection contract including litter control and verification of route pick-up activities of contracted waste hauler in order to provide safe, effective and courteous waste collection service to customers per waste pick-up contracted schedule. The Route Supervisor is the first line supervisor responsible for the productivity of the collection contract and control of litter spread and documentation of illegal dumping. Work is performed within the guidelines of County and departmental procedures and regulations, accepted engineering standards and surveying methods, state guidelines, and approved collection route including waste pick-up schedule. Works with AE&ES other Assistant Directors & Managers, co-workers, employees, private engineers, contractors, developers, surveyors, other City Departments and the public.
PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Monitor hauler daily collection of garbage, yard trimming, and recycling routes to ensure performance according to service level of contract. Ensure daily collection misses are reported, documented and resolved according to contract. Investigate and resolve customer complaints. Conduct vacant lot inspections. Follow the routes to ensure that waste collection contractor (hauler) provides contractual level of service to customers. Responds to missed pick-up dispatch calls or messages. Talk with the hauler to clarify any unique service requirements and to make hauler aware of the situation for the next day service. Address all customer waste pickup issues, complaints, and inquiries by speaking with the customer and/or hauler. Address overloaded carts. Interact with manager, hauler, and customers to ensure customers are serviced in a timely manner.
Educate residents, general public, and citizens of Augusta on the proper storage, collection and solid waste disposal methods. Patrols service area daily to inspect for potential code violations; ensures proper disposal. Determines compliance or non-compliance of bulk waste placed out for collection. Meets with property owners to discuss violations. Issues code compliance notices and official correction notices to inform violators of discrepancies and compliance deadlines. Perform daily route observations to ensure safety procedures are followed, route is picked up, and no noticeable litter in route service area. Ensure waste carts are in good condition, sanitized, debris is picked up around carts, and carts are placed and labeled properly. Complete route observation reports and discuss observations with manager including safety issues, customer calls, route cleanliness, and truck appearance.
Document illegally dumped waste and coordinate its removal internally with manager and other assigned staff. Coordinates impacted area clean ups; visually verify & document work performed to ensure compliance with established specifications/contracts and relevant policy & procedures. Collect illegal dumping & cleaning up data, enter in selected database and generate weekly, monthly, and yearly data report.
In service area, document non-contracted or non-compliance contracted bulky waste and yard waste. Coordinates its removal internally with manager and other assigned staff.
Route all new service starts including obtaining work order, scheduling delivery of container, and service days. Review productivity reports daily (yardage, tonnage, and hauls), reroute non-performing routes to maximize service calls while ensuring that missed pick-ups are minimized. Schedule removal of cans on a timely basis when service is cancelled.
Performs a variety of project related administrative tasks; tracks contract cost and disposal cost to ensure that all activity is accurately documented. Track and document various maintenance/cleanup activities and create quantitative data for such program assessment.
Identify training needs and review with manager. Trains and guides coworkers.
Performs other duties of a similar nature or level.
Provide customer service support to solid waste contractors and customers. Investigates and resolves customer complaints and monitors contractor performance.

Enforce Solid Waste contracts, agreements, policies and procedures. Provide accurate documentation including but not limited to notes, memos, reports, forms, and photographs.
Inspect contracted waste removal routes and conducts improper waste investigation within the guidelines of contractual agreements, state and local waste disposal laws, federal environmental laws, and Augusta-Richmond County regulations.

Resolve issues and takes action/makes recommendations in concert with the current solid waste collection contract(s) to include carts, yard and bulky waste, contractor performance, and solid waste billing.

Enforce Augusta GA Code related to garbage collections, litter conrol, overgrown vegetation, and any other applicable ordinances.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
Education: Associate Degree in related field of study or any equivalent combination of education, training, and experience, which provides the requisite knowledge, skills, and abilities for this job.
Experience: Minimum three (3) years of work experience in transportation, logistics, solid waste operations, code enforcement, law enforcement, structure condition evaluation, or site & building plan review, with emphases on performing field verification.
OTHER
Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:
Knowledge of investigative techniques and processes.
Knowledge of state and local regulations related to solid waste management, guidelines for the proper disposal of asbestos/bio-medical waste, and safety practices and procedures.
Knowledge of customer service principles and practices.
Ability to deal with people in a courteous, tactful, and effective manner.
Familiarity with County and departmental policies and procedures and geography of the County and surrounding area.
Proficient in observing and recalling details accurately.
Demonstrated ability to work independently.
Strong recordkeeping skills.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
Certification:
Preferred (not required): Ability to obtain within twenty-four (24) months of employment: Code Enforcement Officer Certification Program (through GACE).

Licensing:
Possess a valid state operator/driver license for the type of vehicle or equipment operated with a good driving history.

Title: Registered Land Surveyor
Job Description:
General Job Description:
*Must be licensed to qualified to work in the USA.
-Prepare boundary surveys, topographic surveys, utility surveys, ALTA/ACSM Land surveys, as-built surveys, final plats, and reduction of field data
-Project Management
-Communicate with clients
-Manage survey crews
Responsibilities:
-Must maintain a Georgia Registered Land Surveyor (GA RLS) registration and attempt survey registration in others states if requested by SES
-Allocate staff resources within the survey department to complete the necessary tasks and meet project deadlines
-Develop proposals for survey projects
-Responsible for project schedules and timely completion of projects to ensure profitability
-Simultaneously plan, develop, and coordinate multiple projects.
-Plan and conduct project research using on-line and courthouse resources
-Complete boundary computation and calculate boundary closures
-Create staking points from surveying/engineering drawings
-Complete construction staking for civil engineering projects
-Review, sign, and seal surveys
-Serve as SES’ technical specialist for surveying tasks and projects
-Plan, organize, and supervise the work of survey department staff
-Maintain relationships with existing clients and to develop new client relations
-Maintain compliance with all local ordinances and state laws pertaining to land surveying
-Train and mentor staff
Qualifications:

-Able to work under pressure and meet deadlines, while maintaining a positive attitude and providing exemplary customer service
-Work independently and carry out assignments to completion within parameters of instructions given, prescribed routines, and standard accepted practices
-Excellent computer proficiency (Office 365 – Word, Excel, and Outlook, AutoCAD Civil 3d).
-Ability to maintain regular, punctual attendance consistent with the ADA, FMLA and other federal, state, and local standards
-Must be able to pass a background check as required by military, industrial, port, and other client sites
Benefits:
Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Long-term Disability Insurance
Paid Vacation, Personal Time, Holidays
Bonus

No weekends

Title: Assistant County Surveyor
Job Description:
Description
Professional and technical work reviewing the activities of the Survey Section, right-of-way maps and survey field notes from consultants during all phases of the surveying process. Assists the County Surveyor in the day-to-day tasks.

**Salary will be determined depending on qualifications of candidates who exceed the minimum requirements as outlined within the job description.

**Additional compensation based on licensure.
Essential Functions
Note: These are intended only as illustrations of the various types of work performed. The omission of specific duties does not exclude them from the position.
Supervises the work of technical personnel engaged in preparing data pertaining to County projects, including maps, survey notes, legal descriptions, and information for condemnation action.

Reviews consultants’ sketches of description, boundary surveys, etc., for compliance with minimum technical standards and applicable Florida State Statutes, and Seminole County Ordinances.

Acts as survey liaison and technical survey coordinator between Seminole County and its survey consultants.

Initiates and recommends for final approval by the Department Director, hiring, termination, performance evaluation, disciplinary and commendatory actions of selected staff, as assigned.

Reviews all legal surveys and monitors all survey work to assure compliance with established procedures. Certifies and signs plats of legal surveys.

Reviews consultant designed major roadway design projects, right-of-way maps, and survey field notes for composition, accuracy, completeness, and compliance with Seminole County acquisition requirements.

Reviews field notes and findings received from the field. Prepares preliminary estimates for engineering survey projects.

Provides quality assurance review and technical office support as necessary for Seminole County survey operations.

Prepares, signs, and seals surveys as necessary for Seminole County right-of-way acquisition.
Computes, reduces and evaluates survey data from survey crews for accuracy and technical procedure.


Maintain database of all survey related drawings and field notes as required by law.

Research State and County records, prior survey's, Government Land Office Records, and LABINS. Utilize local knowledge of existing conditions of job data for field use by field survey crews.

Maintain County wide Vertical and Horizontal Control Networks.

Prepare Plats of Survey, Maps, Sketches of Description and Design Surveys utilizing Computer Aided Drafting Programs.

Process digital data collected field notes into Auto-Cad Land Development Desktop Software.

Additional Duties :
Act as an expert witness in County condemnation proceedings.

Provides backup support to the County Surveyor's and Survey Chief of Parties positions.

Performs other duties as assigned or as may be necessary.

In the event of an emergency, all employees are considered essential personnel and may be required to perform alternate duties.
Minimum Qualifications
Completion of Bachelor's Degree and a minimum 2 year’s supervisory experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience is required.

A State of Florida Professional Land Surveying License is required and must be maintained.

A comparable amount of education, training, or experience may be substituted for the minimum qualifications.

Additional Requirements
Considerable knowledge of the principles, techniques, and practices of surveying and contract administration.

Must possess the ability to oversee the work of a team engaged in providing specific services, completing specific projects, or assisting other units.

Must possess the ability to work in a dynamic environment that requires the incumbent to be sensitive to change and responsive to changing goals, priorities, and needs.

Must possess the ability to perform professional-level work dealing with data, people, and technology that relates to administrative, technical, scientific, engineering, accounting, legal, or managerial skills.
Knowledge of mathematics through trigonometry and its application to field surveying and engineering computations.

Ability to operate small office equipment, including copy machines or multi-line telephone systems, computers for data entry, word processing, and/or accounting purposes.

Knowledge needed to operate more complex and technical computer applications, such as GIS or CAD.

Ability to use or repair small/light equipment, such as power tools, as well as medium equipment and machinery, such as vehicles or commercial mowers.

Ability to see (perceive color, depth, and texture), smell, hear (preferably at above average levels), and speak.

Must possess and maintain a valid Florida Drivers License.
All employees must attend Seminole County Required Trainings.
Department Specific trainings per position may be required.

Title: Logistics Director
Job Description:
Job Description
This position serves as member in the formulation of plans and the execution of the overall material management activity at a corporate level and assists in the planning and execution of specialized material management functions or may serve as the Logistics Director on medium- to large-sized Engineering, Procurement, Fabrication, and Construction (EPFC) projects.

This role directs the development of all logistics activities including, but not limited to, material identification, Request for Quotations, equipment and material delivery and project close-out. This position provides general and direct supervision to assigned material management activities, primarily related to logistics and other interfacing disciplines that include material planning, purchasing, expediting, and field material management.

This role, in conjunction with Project Quality Management, ensures effective integration of Supplier Quality Surveillance into the Material Management work process. This oversight should be done in accordance with general business acumen, corporate Operating System Requirements (OSR), and the established project and Material Management Plans, policies, and procedures. The person in this role maintains knowledge of business unit activity and keeps the Global Logistics Director or his direct reports informed concerning logistics and project execution matters.

Responsibilities:
Perform project logistics execution
Develop and implement logistics strategy
Execute complex logistically challenging capital projects and ensure successful execution associated with the logistics component of the project(s)
Perform activities associated with lump sum and cost reimbursable capital projects
Oversee activities pertaining to global commerce and trade, as well as global trade compliance standards
Develop high level logistics strategies for complex capital projects
Prepare complex logistics plans and associated logistics budgets (cost and hours) for large size projects
Execute complex logistics plans
Ensure logistics implications are managed regarding Export Credit Agencies finance requirements on projects
Develop complex scopes for logistics contracts (i.e., logistics surveys, transportation, freight forwarding, export packing, customs clearance, etc.)
Ensure compliance with International Commercial Terms (INCOTERMS) and regulations associated with import/export
Coordinate domestic and international shipments in all modes of transportation
Prepare logistics plans and budgets (cost and hours) for medium to large size projects
Provide shipping duration for the planned modes of transportation
Route and arrange transportation of shipments
Develop Project Logistics estimate
Evaluate traffic related proposals such as inland carriers, freight forwarders, export packers, charter shipments, ocean, air, freight rate agreements and custom brokers
Coordinate transportation for normal loads, special oversized loads, hazardous and Complex international shipments by all modes of transportation
Perform expediting and/or tracing activities with carriers, packers, and shipping agents
Support purchasing with carrier related insurance claims for overage, lost or damaged cargo
Audit freight bills
Ensure compliance with all local, state and federal regulations related to transportation, import and export.
Arranging for maritime surveyors
Supervising or coordinating ship, barge and charter aircraft loading / discharging
Determine requirements for, obtaining and administrating export or import licenses of countries through which a shipment will move. Determining and administrating customs and other Documentation requirements.
Supporting and administrating logistics services in coordination with buyers and contract administrators

Identify/Generate/record Cost Savings in Projects under execution by:
Exploring change in terms with vendors (FCA-FAS/FOB or FOB to FCA)
Rate comparison and spot checks of out of contract shipments
Cargo consolidation possibilities across projects
Monitoring market developments that may have positive or negative impact on the project schedules/logistics spend and take appropriate action

Support Corporate Logistics function:
Maintain and constantly update Global contact list of Freight Forwarders, carriers, heavy haulers, other logistics service providers with whom Fluor Global offices interact
Act as single source for providing budgetary quotations for Buyers/Corporate Strategy/Others from Fluor Global network.
Maintain database of carriers/trade lanes across segments, including Heavylift Carriers, Breakbulk Carriers, Liner Services across different trade lanes, Self Propelled Deck carriers, Tugs and Barges, Container Carriers
Maintain technical specifications of most of the regular carriers including, Vessel particulars (Built/Length/Beam/Draft/DWT/Gear Capacity), Clear Deck Space, Dimensions of the Holds including box dimensions available within holds, Vessel deployment outlook (Trade lanes/Long term charters etc)
Maintain regular communication with carriers to identify commercial opportunities from possible empty/light back-hauls, space availabilities on specific voyages etc
Explore options for long-term rate negotiations with carriers
Assist Global logistics leads in RFQ preparations and bid evaluations
Lead Project Logistics & Delegate responsibilities to team members

Additionally:
Provide technical and administrative direction related to the established Company, Material
Management Plan and/or project policies and procedures
Perform periodic formal and documented functional reviews and audits of project Material
Management execution
Prepare and present Logistics-related indoctrination and training sessions to department or project personnel
Prepare and issue relevant Material Management/Logistics reports

Title: WATER MAINTENANCE SUPERVISOR
Job Description:
Position Information


The Department of Environmental Services (DES), Water Sewer Streets (WSS) Bureau, is seeking a dynamic Water Maintenance Supervisor to join our team and lead 12 technicians that provide and ensure an adequate supply of quality water for domestic services and fire protection by investigating and repairing leaks, installing new service connections, and maintaining system pressure and flow.

Specific duties include:

Directing crews on-site in a variety of technical procedures such as repairing water mains and completing water service installations;
Scheduling crew work and ensuring the crew is able to complete work safely using appropriate technical equipment and following applicable County regulations, laws, and accident prevention measures;
Providing training and monitoring employees in the use of a variety of specialized equipment, technical procedures, and safety methods;
Responding, communicating with, and mobilizing the team in emergency situations and resolving site issues as they arise, and ensuring safety precautions are taken;
Ensuring resources, supplies, tools, materials, and equipment are available;
Performing administrative functions including time reporting, activity reports, billing coordination, and personal injury, accident, and vehicle reports; and
Interacting with citizens, contractors, Miss Utility locators, engineers, and surveyors, and on-site facility maintenance staff.
Selection Criteria
Minimum:

High School Diploma/equivalent;
Three (3) years of trades work experience in water distribution, water utility maintenance, or similar environment; and
Experience providing leadership to trades workers and/or managing trades projects.
Desirable: Preference may be given to candidates with experience and/or certification in one or more of the following:
Operating maintenance management software, SCADA, and office administration software;
Providing maintenance and operation of water valves and fire hydrants;
Performing applicable administrative functions;
Possession of a Virginia Water Works Operator Class 5 license; and
Possession of a CDL A or B.
Special Requirements


The applicant must authorize Arlington County to obtain or provide a copy of their official driving record. Any offer of employment will be contingent upon a favorable review of the applicant's driving record.
A pre-employment criminal records check will be conducted. It may include checks of the following: criminal record, driving record, education, professional licensure, and credit history.
You may be required to sign a release authorizing the County to obtain your background information. Any offer of employment will be contingent upon successful completion of a background check.
This position requires learning and following all safety rules and regulations pertaining to job functions which include attending all required safety classes and meetings in order to ensure a safe working environment and to ensure team members are practicing the required safety rules and regulations.
Work is performed in a combination of office and outdoors environments. Outdoor conditions may include all types of weather, moving traffic, exposure to drafts, noise, dust, grease, and dirt with extended periods of standing, walking, bending, crouching, and lifting light to very heavy objects and equipment.
Additional Information


Work hours: Monday - Friday, 6:30 am to 3:00 pm; however, the employee may be required to work other shifts and overtime as needed. Must be available for call back, and emergencies.

The official title of this position is Trades Manager/Leader I.

Arlington County offers a competitive salary and a great benefits package including a Defined Benefit (pension) plan. For more information on Arlington's family friendly benefits click here.

Please complete each section of the application. A resume may be attached; however, it will not substitute a completed application. Your responses to the supplemental questionnaire are considered part of the selection process and are required for this position. Incomplete applications will not be considered.

Title: Survey Technician
Job Description:
Posted under: Survey & Mapping
What does this job entail?
Under the supervision of a Licensed Surveyor or Senior Survey Technician, the Survey Technician will perform surveying and mapping duties for Oil & Gas and Municipal related projects. The Survey Technician will support office and field staff by producing maps, plats, drawings and reports as requested. The Survey Technician will be a champion and leader of our company core values while maintaining internal and external client customer engagement and satisfaction.
Some responsibilities include:
Setting up jobs for drafting, instructing draftsman, and reviewing plats upon completion
Setting up project field work and providing crews with all the required information necessary to perform the project
Importing survey field data and maintaining existing data in files
Checking preliminary data and final products to ensure quality control of all data entering the system
Inputting deeds and plats required for a project into CAD software for analysis
Researching and mapping source documentation, including deeds, correspondence, legal documents, construction plans, and other specific discipline related technical writing
Mapping pipeline right-of-way and pipeline alignment sheets
Mapping Oil & Gas Surface plats and Permit plats for Railroad Commission Permits
Am I qualified for this position?
Associate’s degree in a survey or drafting and design related field with six (6) months of directly related industry experience; three (3) years of experience can be substituted for education
Knowledge of Oil and Gas Industry plats
Previous experience with client communication and/or project management (preferred)
Knowledge of AutoCAD Civil 3D (required) and ArcGIS or ArcMAP (preferred)
Why work for Fenstermaker?

Family

We create unforgettable experiences and build lasting relationships and establish partnerships.
Growth Mindset
We believe growth creates opportunity and gives us the capability of building long-term careers.
Be Different
We encourage and reward innovation.
We serve our clients in ways that make the competition irrelevant.
We create a unique experience for our team members.

Title: Land Surveyor
Job Description:
Discover your full potential. At Tetra Tech, we collaborate with industry-leading experts for a sustainable future for our world. We combine consulting and engineering with advanced analytics and technology to solve the world’s most complex challenges. Our global innovation hubs will enable you to share ideas and best practices while growing your professional network. Wherever you are in your career journey, you will benefit from working with world-class engineers, scientists, and technical specialists.

Apply today and join the company that is Leading with Science®.

Are you ready to take the next step in your career? Do you want to do meaningful work that improves quality of life? At Tetra Tech, you will work with high-performing teams who are passionate about using their expertise to find solutions to complex problems in water, environment, infrastructure, resource management, energy, and international development.

Our Tetra Tech Brighton location is seeking technicians or professional Land Surveyor's In-Training for infrastructure design surveys, construction support surveys, legal boundary and environmental projects. As a firm designated 'essential' for state, county, and municipal work, we have remained operational (and busy) during the COVID-19 pandemic and conduct work in conformance to government health and safety policies. We equip staff with the tools they need to work both in-person and remotely, fostering a culture/environment of teamwork and sharing of skill sets.
Candidate can expect to use all modern surveying equipment (robotic total station, GPS, LIDAR scanner, levels, drones, etc.).
Seeking candidates with strong experience and skill set.
Candidates with less experience will have an excellent opportunity to build their skill set and advance in position & pay rate.
CANDIDATES OF ALL SKILL LEVELS ARE ENCOURAGED TO APPLY!
Most projects are situated in Southeast Michigan.
Primary role will be survey support and survey data processing. It is preferable that candidates have the following:
Experience with (or ability to learn) data processing software
Proficiency with field equipment (GPS, total station, level, etc.) and ability to operate as a 1-person crew (or be responsible with directing a second crew member)
The ability to manage (download, process, adjust) data by computer and data collection devices.
Good communication skills required! (phone, text, email, Teams/Skype, etc.)
Ability to compose reports, keep field notes, and occasionally assist with work plans, safety plans, etc.
Familiarity with legal descriptions, surveys, deeds, plats, as well as construction plans and cut sheets.
Ability to use (or learn) Civil 3D or Microstation.
Degree is not required but is highly valued
About Tetra Tech

Tetra Tech combines the resources of a global, multibillion-dollar company with local, client-focused delivery in more than 550 locations around the world. Our reputation rests on the technical expertise and dedication of our employees — 27,000 associates working together to provide smart, scalable solutions for challenging projects. We are proud to be home to leading technical experts in water, environment, infrastructure, resource management, energy, and international development.

Tetra Tech offers comprehensive benefit options that allow employees to design a plan based on individual needs and assist in planning for long-term financial security. Available benefits include health insurance, term life, disability, accidental death & dismemberment coverage, time off with pay (TOWP), 401k, and an Employee Stock Purchase Plan.

At Tetra Tech, health and safety play a vital role in our success. Tetra Tech’s employees work together to comply with all applicable health & safety practices and protocols, including health orders and regulations related to COVID-19 that are mandated by local, state, and federal authorities.

Explore our open positions at https://www.tetratech.com/careers. Follow us on social media to learn more about our people, culture, and opportunities:

Twitter: @TetraTechJobs
Facebook: @TetraTechCareers

Tetra Tech is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Diversity, inclusion, and equity are among Tetra Tech’s core values. Throughout our history, the company has prioritized the equitable inclusion of all people. All qualified candidates will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, military or veteran status, gender, age, disabilities, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions, genetic information, and any other characteristics protected by the law. Title: Staff Surveyor
Job Description:
Who We Are:
SAM is the nation’s largest combined geospatial solutions and inspection service provider in the industry. We use the industry’s most advanced software and hardware for collecting and analyzing complex spatial data across a wide range of markets and scientific disciplines. Our national reach, expertise, and applied technologies uniquely equip us to capture physical environments from coast to coast — delivering practical insights and high-quality spatial data with unrivaled speed and accuracy.
Your Impact at SAM:
The Geomatics Staff Surveyor is responsible for supervising a team of technicians and field crews to complete large-scale land surveying projects in accordance with the project schedule. This role will coordinate with other Project Surveyors and teams to execute project scope and schedule as established by the Project Manager.
Coordinate with other professional surveyors and teams to execute land survey project scope and schedule as established by the Geomatics Project Manager
Supervise technicians and field crews to complete large-scale land surveying projects
Serve as the client contact for SAM and signing and sealing plats and drawings
Mentor and train a team of technicians on state survey requirements and QA/QC processes
Perform other tasks as assigned to help accomplish the Company’s strategic goals
What You Bring to SAM:
Demonstrated ability to efficiently execute professional land survey tasks
Demonstrated experience in project/phase management for large-scale survey projects
Strong technical skill set, including AutoCAD and MS Office
Professional Land Surveyor License in CO, NM, AZ, or CA
Our Perks:
Opportunity for hybrid work schedules for office positions – Work-life balance is on us
Company paid premiums for medical, dental, vision, LTD and life insurance (HSA and FSA plans available)
Generous paid time off (vacation, sick, holidays and parental leave) – Accrual starts immediately
401(k) program offers 100% employer match up to 5%
Employee Assistance Program – Your mental health is our priority
Tuition reimbursement
No glass ceiling! Truly a place to spread your wings (Ask about our Career Pathing!)
Trainings throughout the year – Specialized in-house trainings programs designed to assist you in advancing in your career
Office snacks, free food and fun-themed events for employees throughout the year
Passion for our Community – You have endless opportunities to volunteer alongside your peers with our Corporate Social Responsibility Program
Our Culture
Our entrepreneurial culture is a key factor in SAM being recognized as a Top Workplace for nine consecutive years, and we make it our mission to ensure every one of our employees learns how to build and manage a business, not just be the subject matter expert on the team. At SAM, our employee’s development is instrumental to our success. Your learning will be supported by specialized in-house training programs and mentoring by the industry’s leading experts, who just happen to be on our staff! We make SAM a GREAT place to work, but it all starts with YOU!

Title: Survey Technician Assistant - 90355063 - Providence
Job Description:
Your success is a train ride away!
As we move America’s workforce toward the future, Amtrak connects businesses and communities across the country. We employ more than 20,000 diverse, energetic professionals in a variety of career fields throughout the United States. The safety of our passengers, our employees, the public and our operating environment is our priority, and the success of our railroad is due to our employees.

Are you ready to join our team?
Our values of ‘Do the Right Thing, Excel Together and Put Customers First’ are at the heart of what matters most to us, and our Core Capabilities, ‘Building Trust, Accountability, Effective Communication, Customer Focus, and Proactive Safety & Security’ are what every employee needs to know and do to be most impactful at Amtrak. By living the Amtrak values, focusing on our capabilities, and actively embracing and fostering diverse ideas, backgrounds, and perspectives, together we will honor our past and make Amtrak a company of the future.

SUMMARY OF DUTIES:
Entry Level Surveyor performs beginning level semi-technical survey work under the direct supervision of Survey Technician and Senior Survey Technician. Tasks may be physically demanding while requiring limited initiative and minimal independent judgement. The Survey Technician Assistant would be responsible for the cleaning and care of equipment and vehicles, measuring and marking distances and assisting in establishing lines and grades. This employee works under direct supervision receiving detailed instructions from a Survey Technician or Senior Survey Technician.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Works under the direct supervision of a Survey Technician and Survey Technician Leader
Maintains necessary equipment and supplies in field vehicle
Utilizes plumb bob and tape or prism pole to assist in the establishment of survey lines and measuring distances
Utilizes level rod to establish grades and transfer elevations
Operates metal locator, shovel, hammer or other hand tool to recover or establish survey control

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
High School Diploma
Certified as a National Society of Professional Surveyors “Certified Survey Technician Level 1”
Qualified in AMTRAK RWP and AMT II
Fundamental knowledge of general mathematics
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel and Power Point).
Attention to detail and completeness.
Valid driver’s license

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Participation in a professional surveying society

WORK ENVIRONMENT:
Most work is performed outdoors in a rigorous and dynamic environment.
Occasionally working nights, being out in inclement weather, being exposed to high-speed trains or heavy construction equipment and doing extensive walking.
Work hours vary from day-to-day and week-to-week as project deadlines move.
Travel: 10%

COMMUNICATIONS AND INTERPERSONAL SKILLS:
Must have excellent oral and written communication skills.

The salary/hourly range is $51,830-$67,170, Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, internal equity, etc. Depending on an employee’s assigned worksite or location, Amtrak may consider a geo-pay differential to be applied to the employee’s base salary. Amtrak may offer additional incentive and pay programs to recognize and reward our employees, including a short-term incentive bonus based upon factors such as individual and company performance that is commensurate with the level of the position and/or long-term incentive plan compensation. In addition to your salary, Amtrak offers a comprehensive benefit package that includes health, dental, and vision plans; health savings accounts; wellness programs; flexible spending accounts; 401K retirement plan with employer match; life insurance; short and long term disability insurance; paid time off; back-up care; adoption assistance; surrogacy assistance; reimbursement of education expenses; Public Service Loan Forgiveness eligibility; Railroad Retirement sickness and retirement benefits; and rail pass privileges. Learn more about our benefits offerings here.
Requisition ID:157826
Posting Location(s):Rhode Island
Job Family/Function:Mechanical
Relocation Offered:No
Travel Requirements:Up to 25%

Amtrak employees power our progress through their performance.

We want your work at Amtrak to be more than a job – we want it to be a fulfilling experience where you find challenging and rewarding opportunities, respect among colleagues, competitive pay, benefits that protect you and your family and a high performance culture that recognizes and values your contributions and helps you reach your career goals.

All positions require pre-employment background check verification, a pre-employment drug screen and proof of full vaccination against COVID -19. Amtrak is committed to a safe workplace free of drugs and alcohol and performs pre-employment substance abuse testing. Marijuana, notwithstanding any statute, ordinance, regulation, or other law that legalizes or decriminalizes the use or possession of marijuana, whether for medical, recreational, or other use. Candidates who engage in the usage of marijuana will not be qualified for hire. Successful applicants for employment with Amtrak must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by the date of hire as a condition of employment, subject to requests for accommodation. Fully vaccinated means 14 days have elapsed since receiving the second dose of the Pfizer or Moderna vaccine or 14 days since receiving the Johnson & Johnson vaccine.

In accordance with DOT regulations (49 CFR § 40.25), Amtrak is required to obtain prior drug and alcohol testing records for applicants/employees intending to perform safety-sensitive duties for covered Department of Transportation positions. If an applicant/employee refuses to provide written consent for Amtrak to obtain these records, the individual will not be permitted to perform safety-sensitive functions.

In accordance with federal law governing security checks of covered individuals for public transportation ( Title 6 U.S.C. § 1143), Amtrak is required to screen applicants for any permanent or interim disqualifying criminal offenses.

Note that any education requirement listed above may be deemed satisfied if you have an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Amtrak is an EOE/Affirmative Action Minority/Female employer, and we welcome all to apply. Title: Field Scientist/Herpetologist
Job Description:
Job Description
General Responsibilities:
Conduct surveys and studies for northern red-bellied cooter (Pennsylvania-listed threatened species) and other state and federally listed (T&E) herpetofauna. Conduct environmental site investigations, assessments, and surveys to sample, evaluate, and analyze terrestrial ecosystems including, but not limited to, riverine, wetland, and upland. Identify, evaluate, and recommend risk, remediation, and liability management strategies/designs to ensure compliance with federal, state, and local regulations. Prepare applicable permit applications, risk assessments, and technical documents including proposals, reports and regulatory agency correspondence and filings. Coordinate and develop environmental protection plans. Projects may include ecological and natural resource field surveys, construction monitoring and oversight, stormwater management inspection, and site planning and permitting.

Essential Roles and Responsibilities:
Follow safety rules, guidelines, and standards for all projects. Participate in pre-task planning. Report any safety issues or concerns to management.
Be responsible for maintaining quality standards on all projects.
Entry-to Mid-level scientific professional responsible for gathering data and information to be evaluated and analyzed independently and by other team members.
Conduct field studies related to wetland and watercourse delineation, stream assessments, and wildlife studies.
Performs testing and sampling of environmental systems including wetlands, streams, lakes, soils, etc.
Provides environmental compliance monitoring, inspection, oversight and reporting.
Tabulate and prepare data for written reports.
Assist with report preparation by summarizing data and information within reports.
Operates field monitoring equipment.
Maintains, calibrates, and provides responsible care and routine inspection of all field equipment.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Environmental Science or related science field and a minimum 1 year related experience. Or, in lieu of a degree, a minimum of 5 years’ related experience.
Valid driver’s license with acceptable violation history.
Preferred Certification:
Certification in field of expertise.
Pennsylvania Fish and Boat Commission (PFBC) northern red-bellied cooter qualified surveyor.

About Terracon
Terracon is a 100 percent employee-owned consulting engineering firm providing quality services to clients. Since 1965, Terracon has evolved into a successful multi-discipline firm specializing in environmental, facilities, geotechnical, and materials services. Terracon currently has more than 5,000 employees in more than 150 offices with services available in all 50 states. Terracon’s growth is due to valued employees exceeding expectations in client service and growing their careers with new and exciting opportunities in the marketplace.

Terracon’s vision of “Together, we are best at people” is demonstrated through our excellent compensation and benefits package. Based on eligibility, role and job status, we offer many programs including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401(k) plan, paid time off and holidays, education reimbursement, and various bonus programs.
EEO Statement
Terracon is an EEO employer. We encourage qualified minority, female, veteran and disabled candidates to apply and be considered for open positions. We do not discriminate against any applicant for employment, or any employee because of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender, disability, age, or military status.

Title: Chief Deputy Surveyor
Job Description:
CLASSIFICATION TITLE: CHIEF DEPUTY SURVEYOR
CLASSIFICATION NUMBER: 073
CLASSIFFICATION CATEGORY: MANAGEMENT/EXEMPT
DEPARTMENT: Linn County Surveyor’s Office
GENERAL JOB DUTIES: Perform supervisory and advanced technical survey work in making land and road
surveys and re-establishing section or designated land claim corners. Serve as the County Surveyor's principle
assistant.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE JOB:
Assign, coordinate, supervise and perform survey field work.
Provide training for field survey personnel for improved efficiency and accuracy in performing work.
Coordinate right-of-way survey work with the various district supervisors in the Road Department.
Insure that survey work or survey-related projects are properly surveyed and are performed in a timely
fashion.
Process raw field data into a survey map which will be filed as a Linn County Survey.
Evaluate existing deed descriptions on roads and properties owned by Linn County or others.
Inspect each job prior to assigning work crews. Inspect jobs for progress and to resolve any questions or
problems.
Assume responsibilities delegated by the County Surveyor in the absence of the County Surveyor.
QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
Thorough knowledge of the principles and practices of surveying as applied to county land surveying projects.
Thorough knowledge of the operation and maintenance of surveying equipment. Thorough knowledge of
surveying techniques, principles and practices. Considerable knowledge of records maintenance systems. Skill in
the use of survey and office equipment.
Five years of progressively responsible surveying experience with four years of experience in a supervisory
capacity; four years of college level coursework in surveying or civil engineering; or any satisfactory equivalent
combination of experience, education and training which demonstrates the ability to perform the work described.
Possession of a valid Oregon Professional Land Surveyor’s License. Possession of a valid Oregon Motor Vehicle
Operator's License and an acceptable driving record.
SALARY, BENEFITS, COMPENSATION: Linn County offers an excellent benefits package which includes fully paid
contribution to the Oregon Public Employees Retirement System, paid holiday, vacation and sick leave, options for
medical, dental and vision care insurance, options for deferred compensation, an employee assistance program,
longevity pay, alternate and flexible work schedules and more. Current salary range and total compensation
(depending on qualifications):

SALARY RANGE: $5,836 - $7,368 per month
CLOSING DATE: OPEN UNTIL FILLED
HOW TO APPLY: Submit a completed Linn County Employment Application Form along with a resume and cover
letter to: Thomas J. Casey, Linn County Surveyor, PO Box 100, Albany, Oregon 97321; FAX: 541-967-3801.
Application forms may be obtained, along with the Job Classification, at the Linn County webpage www.co.linn.or.us.

LINN COUNTY IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY/AFFIRMATIVE ACTION EMPLOYER

Title: GIS Specialist
Job Description:
JOB SUMMARY:
The GIS Specialist is responsible for processing spatial and environmental data through multiple geospatial and environmental desktop software platforms to create products used for final planning and reporting deliverables. This position supports the GIS Manager, receiving direction and assignments for completion. Collaboration will occur with field scientists, geologists, project chemists, surveyors, engineers, technical editors, and project managers to meet project objectives.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Cartography with ArcGIS for Desktop® software suite (version 10.7):
Develop environmental report figures using map document templates, in a variety of layout formats.
Develop, organize, manage, and deliver geodatabases to clients that meet specific contract standards.
Integrate geodatabases with other data management tools.
Produce maps using both raster and vector spatial data model structures.
Create, organize, and edit point, line and polygon datasets.
Establish update metadata.
Incorporate AutoCAD® drawings into GIS mapping.
Ensure good cartographic and engineering design with proper scaling
GNSS Data Collection and Processing:
Managing mapping GNSS data collectors and GPS software
Loading and post processing of GPS data via GPS Pathfinder Office®, ArcGIS Collector® and ArcGIS Pro®.
Migrating GPS and processed survey data to project geodatabases.
Geospatial Support:
Collect, create and manage spatial data, including design and use of relational databases and querying tools.
Work in a constant state of alertness and in a safe manner.
Perform other duties as directed.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES
This position has no supervisory responsibilities.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, & ABILITIES:
Proficient in ESRI ArcGIS for Desktop® , Autodesk AutoCAD Map3D®/Civil3D®, Trimble Pathfinder Office®, Microsoft Word®, Excel® and Outlook® in addition to Microsoft Access®.
Familiarity with ArcGIS Pro®, ArcGIS Online® environment, ArcGIS Collector®, ArcGIS Survey123®; Bentely gINT®, Trimble Pathfinder Office, Golden Surfer® and Trimble TerraSync® is a plus.
Must be adept at understanding map projections, vertical and geodetic datums, and coordinate system transformations.
Must be adept at understanding technical aspects of environmental field work for conversion to graphics.
Must be highly organized and able to manage multiple assignments from multiple clients with competing deadlines.
Adept at learning new computer software and ability to productively maneuver through multiple software platforms.
QUALIFICATIONS
Strong experience in use of ESRI® and Autodesk® software for preparing maps, creating spatial datasets and manipulating geodatabases.
Bachelor of Science Degree in environmental science, geospatial science or other related discipline required.
WORKING ENVIRONMENT:
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Brice Environmental has a fast-paced multi-tasking office environment requiring a high degree of efficient and effective performance. At times, work is performed outside of the office at indoor and outdoor job sites. Adaptability regarding schedule and design changes, and occasional overtime for immediate field support or bid processing may be necessary.
PHYSICAL/VISUAL/MENTAL/ENVIRONMENTAL DEMANDS:
The demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

Title: Site Surveyor
Job Description:
We are seeking a hard-working, innovative, detail-oriented, and creative team player to join our Solar field operations department as a full-time Site surveyor located in Orlando, FL. The individual we are looking for is also someone that enjoys working in a team environment but also excels atworking at an individual level.
The Site Surveyor will play a critical role in the success of the business with their regions, teams, and dealers. This will be a dual-function role. You will complete a Site Survey for our PV design teams by capturing photos needed in order to design a PV and one-line drawing. In addition, our technicians must meet with the Municipal or Utility Inspector and provide adequate information regarding the solar installation process and system components. You may also be required to perform or document needed minor maintenance and repairs on solar systems during an inspection.
Location: on-site and around Orlando, FL
What we offer:
Competitive pay
Company vehicle provided which can be taken home nightly
Phone allowance
Group Health, Dental, and Vision plans
Pet insurance, Life insurance, and EAP benefits
401K with employer match
Paid holidays and paid time off
Opportunity for advancement
Upbeat and exciting company culture and much more!
Roles and Responsibilities:
Take Site Survey photos required by design and engineering teams
Deliver predetermined photos within given SLA
Ability to work at heights greater than 8 feet, work in extreme environments (hot and cold), perform repetitive duties for prolonged periods, and the ability to lift at least 30 pounds
Perform PV inspections per the authority having jurisdiction
Meet with city inspectors at the job site to complete on-site inspection
Daily management of plan revisions that needed to be delivered on-site
Analyze, prepare, and validate the sites before an inspection is performed
Review inspection reports and communicate with the Local Management Team
Ensure all documents are properly filled out correctly
Proactively resolve equipment and system issues to troubleshoot and overcome obstacles on-site during the initial inspection
Requirements:
This is an opportunity for a great career with no experience necessary; we will train you
A current and valid US driver’s license that has been active for a minimum of 4 years is required
A clean driving record is required (no more than one moving violation in the past year and no more than 2 moving violations in the past 4 years)
A drug test and background check will be performed on all new hires
Qualifications:
High school diploma or equivalent
Have good communication skills with people of varied backgrounds and ability levels
Trustworthy and dependable
Effectively manage time
Basic knowledge of home construction is preferred, but not required.
Must be able to successfully pass pre-employment screening requirements and have valid and current US Driver's License
Knowledge of NEC and local AHJ requirements for PV installations
2 years of experience (minimum) with PV equipment and installation, preferably residential
Previous experience working with power/hand tools and electrical equipment, and ability to independently navigate numerous computer applications and technology
Ambia:
Ambia is a residential Solar Panel installer in the United States. Ambia is dedicated to providing homeowners with power for their homes, while offering a unique and quality customer experience from start to finish.
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice. If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please inform your recruiter.
Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:
401(k)
401(k) matching

Health insurance
Health savings account

Weekend availability

Experience:
PV equipment and installation: 2 years (Preferred)
License/Certification:
Driver's License (Required)
Work Location: In person

Health insurance

Title: Surveyor Coordinator
Job Description:
Subsidiary: Barrett Industries

Barrett Paving Materials Inc. is one of the companies that operates within Barrett Industries Corporation, the Colas USA subsidiary that operates primarily in Maryland, Ohio, Pennsylvania, and New York. Barrett Paving is a leader in heavy civil construction with a vertically integrated value chain which includes aggregate production, hot mix asphalt plants, asphalt paving services, and a wide range of road construction work. We engage in heavy civil and commercial construction projects in counties throughout Upstate NY, specializing in airport and highway work. The mission of Barrett Paving has been to strengthen and grow by empowering our people, fostering innovation, and utilizing new technology. To learn more about Barrett Paving visit www.barrettpaving.com/.

Throughout Colas USA, we provide competitive pay, outstanding benefits, career advancement opportunities, professional education, and extensive training for every employee. We pride ourselves on upholding the highest standards of safety, environmental conservation, and ethical conduct as we strive to grow our infrastructure products and services through empowering and developing our people, fostering innovation, utilizing new technology, and maximizing vertical integration at all levels of the company’s value chain. To learn more about the Colas USA Family of Companies, please visit www.colasusa.com.

Barrett Paving, and the rest of the Colas USA Family of Companies, is part of the Colas Group, the worldwide leader in transportation infrastructure construction and maintenance. For information on our international network visit www.colas.com.
Job Summary
Conduct job surveys and GPS file construction to determine precise location and measurements of points, elevations, grades, lines, areas, quantities, and contours, for earthwork projects such as road and highway construction.
Main Responsibilities
Using Topcon GPS equipment calculates dimensions, locations and quantities of materials such as dirt, borrow, aggregate, and other construction materials to produce information for construction planning.
Pound high lathe and/or other ground markers into ground marking cuts/fill limits, new road alignments, construction limits, slopes, as needed.
Assigns GPS equipment to company projects. Routinely monitors whereabouts and condition of GPS equipment Initiates maintenance and repair procedures on GPS hardware and software as needed.
Trains company employees how to properly use and handle GPS hardware and related systems.
Sets up machine control GPS units on site. Ensures on site GPS equipment is working properly.
Convert DOT and other design files for use by Topcon GPS and other company software.
Using Magnet, Office 3D and Pocket3D software, arrange electronic data into useful format for construction planning and construction.
Reviews and interprets project plans and specs for the purpose of surveying.
Keeps accurate notes, records, and sketches to describe and present work performed.
Coordinates findings with project superintendents and project managers and others concerned with the project.
Skills
Carries out the site visit by highlighting specific points with the help of the site layout.
Must have good verbal and written communication skills.
Must be experienced using Magnet, Office 3D and Pocket 3D software.
Ability to upload models, verify control, and set base stations within project limits.
Physical
Typically requires site visits.
Outdoors and uneven terrain.
Ability to move GPS and surveying equipment around.

Title: Life Safety Code Surveyor - One Week Every Other Month
Job Description:
Overview:
GENERAL SUMMARY:
The Life Safety Code Surveyor, with minimal immediate direction or supervision, reviews assigned functions in Life Safety, Environment of Care, and Emergency Management throughout the United States. Life Safety Code Surveyors apply sophisticated analysis skills and inductive reasoning skills to assess health care organizations' compliance and to identify opportunities for improving compliance with applicable Joint Commission standards, policies, and protocols.
Responsibilities:
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Life Safety Code Surveyors must be able to perform the following essential job duties and functions:
Learn, understand, retain, explain and objectively apply Joint Commission standards, including continual updating and retraining regarding Life Safety, Environment of Care, and Emergency Management standards and technologies.


Conduct a thorough and credible evaluation of assigned services that meet Life Safety, Environment of Care, and Emergency Management standards.


Plan, review and apportion survey time so that all survey requirements are addressed thoroughly on every survey.


Review and evaluate pre-survey information and conduct all pre-survey activities; research, collect, organize, and interpret information from multiple sources. This includes identifying and using organization-specific information based upon an evaluation of priority focus areas.


Conduct comprehensive interview facilities managers and other staff to determine level of compliance with standards.


Analyze documents, such as policies, procedures, testing documentation, safety committee meeting minutes, etc., to assess the level of compliance with Joint Commission standards, evidence of performance improvement, and safety and quality of care.


Using established survey protocols:
Analyze written self-descriptive program information.
Participate in and conduct relevant on-site activities, including without limitation inspections, required conferences, tours, and interviews.
Analyze and interpret all data submitted by the organization.
Document all observations in a thorough, accurate manner utilizing applicable surveyor technology, providing adequate indication of non-compliance where appropriate.
Submit survey findings in a complete and accurate manner through WST and consult with the survey team leader as appropriate.
Interpret and explain the intent of the standards to the organization�s personnel in a detailed, constructive, sensitive, and professional manner. This often includes the ability to communicate negative information in a constructive manner.
Consult with the organization during survey concerning non-compliance, opportunities for improvement, and remedial action required. Recommends publications and other resources that clarify standards and/or demonstrate compliance with standards.


Maintain current knowledge of, apply and follow Joint Commission Life Safety, Environment of Care, and Emergency Management standards and requirements over which they have review responsibility, including without limitation:
Joint Commission policies and procedures to ensure that its mission is achieved;
Current federal regulations pertinent to the Environment of Care and Emergency Management standards;
LSC requirements; and
Relevant, contemporary knowledge in professional field of expertise.


Collaborate in a productive manner with colleagues to ensure that the mission of the Joint Commission is achieved, including conducting interactive evaluation sessions with staff and offering relevant consultation where improvement is needed.


Life Safety Code Surveyor are required to travel extensively, including travel on weekends, at all times of the day/night, and without prior notice, travel by automobile and on airplanes of all sizes, and travel in all weather conditions. This includes the ability to travel to all types of airports and in whatever type of ground transportation is necessary to enable timely performance of surveyor duties.


Ability to provide regular and timely attendance.


Complete all applicable administrative responsibilities, including accurate peer evaluations, educational and development programs.
Preparing for on-site review;
Interactions with Standards Interpretation Group; and
Presentations to Accreditation Committee as requested.


Follow customers' safety policies when on site, including following requested safety measures (e.g., wearing appropriate protective clothing or equipment, limiting number and locations of ceiling tiles removed, etc.) provided that such policies are not in conflict with Joint Commission policies.
Qualifications:
KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS REQUIRED:
Education:
Master's degree in related field or equivalent level of education preferred.
Bachelor's degree in related field.
College degree must be from accredited institutions of higher learning.


Certification/Licensure/Registration: Current certification/licensure/registration in a field related to plant, technology, and safety management [i.e., Certified Healthcare Facility Manager (CHFM), Certified Healthcare Safety Professional (CHSP), Healthcare Environmental Manager (HEM), Certified Industrial Hygienist (CIH), Certified Safety Professional (CSP), Professional Engineer (PE)] or able to attain within one year of hire.


General Knowledge and Experience:
Eight years of hospital experience in facilities management, including at least five years in a management position in engineering, facilities management, hazardous materials and waste management, emergency preparedness, biomedical equipment, and/or utility systems as well as experience as the organization's Safety Officer.
Knowledge of Joint Commission Environment of Care standards including the Life Safety Code (NFPA101) and other relevant NFPA standards and direct involvement with a minimum of two Joint Commission surveys.


Analytical Skills:
Ability to research, collect, organize, interpret, and communicate information from multiple sources (i.e., documentation, observation, interviews) to assess the degree of compliance with Joint Commission standards.
Ability to critically review and analyze performance measurement data.
Ability to objectively assess organization performance.
Ability to differentiate and assess the adequacy of alternative/innovative approaches to standards compliance, consistent with survey policy and protocols.
Ability to analyze and synthesize survey findings to provide conclusions, recommendations, and educational opportunities.


Analytical Skills:
Ability to be sensitive to and respectful of all internal and external stakeholders and customers, without compromising in any way on the message that must be delivered.
Open to direction, inquiry and idea exchange.
Superior listening skills, including being able to detect, attentive and responsive to verbal and nonverbal communication cues.
Ability to work with diverse stakeholders and customers, including multi-cultural sensitivity.


Interpersonal Skills:
Sensitive to and respectful of all internal and external customers.
Open to inquiry and exchange.
Responsive to verbal and nonverbal communication cues.
Multi-cultural sensitivity.


Professionalism:
Behavior consistent with Joint Commission values (i.e., Quality, Respect, Integrity, Courtesy, Teamwork, Recognition, Improvement, Empowerment, and Responsiveness).
Dependability, including delivering on commitments, assuming appropriate share of all work, being prepared, and adhering to schedules.
Professionalism, including appearance and demeanor.


Organizational Skills:
Ability to independently organize work into a smooth flow and to be flexible as necessitated by unique circumstances.
Demonstrate effective time management skills.
Coordinate activities involving other people.


Interviewing Skills:
Ability to elicit information through appropriate use of open-ended questions and active listening.
Ability to explore information through effective use of follow-up questions.


Problem Solving Skills: Exercise independent judgment, including as follows:
Independent decision-making skills to direct and effectively manage the survey and review processes in a timely manner.
Ability to objectively assess organization performance.
Ability to set priorities independently and collectively.
Ability to openly and appropriately discuss conflicts/controversy.
Judgment and ability to seek assistance when appropriate to make decisions, resolve conflicts, and/or achieve consensus.


Written and Verbal Communication Skills:
Ability to make presentations and produce written materials which are confident, accurate, clear, concise, complete, well organized, understandable by others, and responsive to the needs of the customer.
Ability to act as a resource and consultant with customers.


Availability:
Participation in a precepted program that may vary in length and duration.
Completion of up to six (6) surveys with a preceptor in order to demonstrate an understanding of the Joint Commission�s standards and their interpretation, survey process, survey technology, presentation techniques, general policies and procedures, and organization structure.
Ongoing participation in continuing education activities, including those sponsored by the Joint Commission, (i.e., Annual Educational Conference, teleconferences, self-directed learning activities, e-learning modules, webinars, distance learning programs, and special conferences).
Ability to meet one of the following availability requirements depending upon employment status:
Full time available 52 weeks/year less vacation, personal, and holiday time
Part time 2 or 3 calendar weeks per month
Intermittent one survey every other month
Weekend travel is required, as directed


Physical Abilities: This job is very physical, and requires the following abilities:
To observe, in real time and without slowing or otherwise interrupting the progress of, the building tour during weather and other extreme situations, etc.


To stand for long periods of time, walking lengthy distances, lifting, climbing, stooping, pulling, kneeling, and pushing in order to adequately inspect and observe all medical facilities, equipment and procedures, such as emergency exit procedures, remote storage facilities, any areas where cleanliness may affect the possibility of infection, medical equipment, etc.


To engage in extensive travel as set forth above, including driving a car to remote locations, flying on small airplanes and into small airports, traveling in all types of weather conditions, etc.


To work in settings in which dust, allergens, and infectious diseases are present.


To lift, push and pull a minimum of 25 pounds.


To walk up and down stairways (e.g., to test escape routes, assess safety of emergency exits, regulatory compliance, etc.);


To remove obstructed covers or impediments to equipment or other mechanical areas;


To examine small and often dirty printed labels and print on equipment;


To examine exhaust mechanisms, duct work and laundry chutes in hard-to-reach areas such as ceilings, utility spaces and mechanical rooms;


To climb ladders and fire escapes (e.g., to ensure usable, unobstructed escape routes are maintained, assess ceilings for penetrations and other risks);


To kneel, stoop, and crawl into tight areas such as crawl spaces housing mechanical fixtures (e.g., to assess equipment and assess risks);


To climb over or under pipes, ductwork or other obstructions;


To straddle and balance in relatively unstable environments that are not designed for typical occupation by patients or most employees of the health care organization.


To use a laptop computer and life safety tools and equipment.


We are currently hiring for our next orientation class to take place on May 8, 2023.

The description is not an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, knowledge, skills and abilities, and working conditions associated with this position. All requirements are subject to possible modification due to business needs and/or reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities.

Title: Landscape Inspector
Company: Tectonic Engineering Consultants, Geologists & Land Surveyors, D.P.C.

Title: LAND SURVEYOR
Job Description:
To join our team of engineers, planners and surveyors, send resume and cover letter to:
Omsberg & Preston
Attn: Kim Preston
402 E Street
Eureka, CA 95501
Email: kpreston@omsberg.com

LAND SURVEYOR – We are currently looking for a land surveyor with 2 years’ experience in rural land surveying, often on steep, uneven terrain. California LS desirable, but not required, or have completed the LSIT with the desire to obtain professional licensure within one year. AutoCAD, robotic total station and/or GPS experience a must. Applicant should have experience in boundary and topographic surveying and mapping, a desire to manage the survey department and possess strong organizational, communication and time management skills.

Duties include:
* Managing the survey department
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
* Job estimating, budgeting and contract preparation
* Work independently and as part of the team
* Meeting project timelines
* Strong client relation skills

Skills/knowledge requirements:
* Scheduling the field crew
* Strong field skills in corner search & recovery, topographic mapping, boundary surveying & construction staking
* Map & deed research
* Calculations & computations associated with boundary resolution
* Preparation of Maps, Records of Surveys, Corner Records, Flood Elevation Certificates, ALTAs and legal descriptions/plats
* Strong communication & writing skills
* Experience with AutoCAD or Traverse PC

Salary Range: $75,000 to $100,000 per year, depending upon experience

Title: Distribution Designer
Job Description:
Stanley Consultants is currently seeking a Distribution Designer to join our Denver office.
Primary duties include assisting a lead distribution designer and project manager leading a distribution design team in the development of plans, specifications, calculations and staking sheets, including being responsible for collecting field data, line staking, and updating records for the design of medium voltage electric utility distribution facilities.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES:
Responsible for assisting in the design of medium voltage (typically 12.47/7.2 kV) distribution lines for a variety of electric utility clients.
Design projects include a significant amount of field work gathering GPS data, equipment inventory, and determine the best route for the new or refurbished line.
Will often work with more senior employees in the field, acting as a design or staking assistant.
Assists in obtaining field and shop measurements and prepares preliminary sketches.
Assists in the collection and analysis of data from reports, maps, drawings, product catalogs, tests, and aerial photographs to plan and design projects.
Use data gathered for projects from catalogs and other reference materials as directed.
Assists in client contact and communication pertaining to specific projects.
Prepares and checks design computations and quantity estimates.
Assists in the preparation or modification of reports, specifications, plans, environmental impact studies, permits and designs for projects.
Performs site visits or field assignments as required.
Perform other work-related duties as assigned.
Requirements:
Must be able to lift 50 pounds
Must be able to travel up to 50%
Must be able to work overtime
Must possess a valid clear driver’s license
Must be detail oriented, work well with other groups, and maintain a positive attitude in a fast paced environment
The candidate should be proficient using Microsoft Office and able to learn new software packages efficiently
Strong analytical and technical writing skills
Self-motivated to perform assigned tasks and take initiative to learn new skills
Preferred:
Surveyor Experience
GPS Equipment

Hourly Range: Base Compensation: $30.00 - $35.00 / Hour
In accordance with the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act actual compensation is subject to variation due to such factors as education, experience, skillset, and/or location.
